2018-07-09.abstract: American presidents are usually seen as leaders at NATO, but Mr. Trump might play the role of agitator, sowing disagreement that would play into Russia’s hands.
2018-07-09.snippet: American presidents are usually seen as leaders at NATO, but Mr. Trump might play the role of agitator, sowing disagreement that would play into Russia’s hands.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — NATO summit meetings were once ritualistic events, with the member nations assembling to proclaim that the alliance had never been stronger and pledging to work together on the security issues of the day.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Trump Poised to Enter NATO Meeting as Wild Card Among Allies

2018-07-09.abstract: Facing intense criticism, Customs and Border Protection denied accusations that its officers had separated families and turned away migrants seeking asylum at official ports of entry.
2018-07-09.snippet: Facing intense criticism, Customs and Border Protection denied accusations that its officers had separated families and turned away migrants seeking asylum at official ports of entry.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Facing a barrage of criticism over their agency’s role in carrying out the Trump administration’s “zero tolerance” immigration policy at the border, officials at Customs and Border Protection went on the offensive on Monday to deny claims that officers at official ports of entry had separated families and turned away migrants seeking asylum in the United States.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Migrant Families Who Enter at Legal Ports Are Rarely Separated, Customs Officials Say

2018-07-09.abstract: The inspiration for Ulli’s Oil Mill may be Austrian, but these plant-seed oils are made in Long Island City, Queens.
2018-07-09.snippet: The inspiration for Ulli’s Oil Mill may be Austrian, but these plant-seed oils are made in Long Island City, Queens.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: For Ulrike Sitter, pressing plant seeds for oil is a tradition she has imported from her native Austria, where toasted pumpkinseed oil is a culinary staple. Ms. Sitter does her work at the Entrepreneur Space in Long Island City, Queens, making hempseed, rapeseed, sunflower-based chile and camelina seed (tea seed) oils from crops grown upstate. For now, she produces her pumpkinseed oil from Austrian seeds, but she expects to have New York-grown pumpkin seeds soon. Each oil is best used as a finishing oil to season food, though camelina oil — earthy and with a high smoke point — is effective for cooking.
2018-07-09.headline_main: An Oil for That Final Finish

2018-07-09.abstract: Jason Roche, 41, was charged with murder after videos showed the victim, Devonte Ortiz, 19, wasn’t holding a gun and may have been running away.
2018-07-09.snippet: Jason Roche, 41, was charged with murder after videos showed the victim, Devonte Ortiz, 19, wasn’t holding a gun and may have been running away.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: When he spoke with the police in Austin, Tex., on July 4, Jason Roche said he had fatally shot Devonte Ortiz in self-defense.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Texas Man Kills Teenager Over Fireworks and Claims Self-Defense

2018-07-09.abstract: “The Gin Dictionary” by David T. Smith looks at the history of the spirit, with cocktail recipes.
2018-07-09.snippet: “The Gin Dictionary” by David T. Smith looks at the history of the spirit, with cocktail recipes.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: Summer is gin’s moment, as the spirit has an essential place in long coolers like Tom Collins and gin and tonic. This new illustrated guide will enhance your gin appreciation, with entries about styles, distilling techniques, the botanicals and spices that go into gin, history, profiles of top brands and 20 basic recipes. But it won’t help you know anything about pink gin: As comprehensive as this book is, that entry is missing.
2018-07-09.headline_main: A New Book Gins Up Answers

2018-07-09.abstract: In Lynne Tillman’s novel “Men and Apparitions,” Zeke Stark explores how the feminist movement has affected men.
2018-07-09.snippet: In Lynne Tillman’s novel “Men and Apparitions,” Zeke Stark explores how the feminist movement has affected men.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: MEN AND APPARITIONSBy Lynne TillmanIllustrated. 397 pp. Soft Skull Press. Paper, $16.95.
2018-07-09.headline_main: An Instagram-Obsessed Anthropologist Riffs on the Meaning of ‘Maleness’

2018-07-09.abstract: The first product from a line inspired by the singer’s family recipes is available only at Dean & DeLuca.
2018-07-09.snippet: The first product from a line inspired by the singer’s family recipes is available only at Dean & DeLuca.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: A bit spicy, a bit sweet, a bit tart: NoNo Sauce combines all these attributes in a sauce meant for marinating, basting and glazing, especially with grilling in mind. The recipe is from Pharaoh Williams, the father of the singer and songwriter Pharrell Williams. It’s the first product in a line of foods, Williams Family Kitchen, developed and produced by Dean & DeLuca. As for the name, that’s the answer you get when you ask what exactly it is.
2018-07-09.headline_main: This Barbecue Sauce Makes Pharrell Williams Happy

2018-07-09.abstract: At Dez in NoLIta, a new flavor is unveiled each month for a limited engagement.
2018-07-09.snippet: At Dez in NoLIta, a new flavor is unveiled each month for a limited engagement.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: For dessert at Dez, the Middle-Eastern fast-casual restaurant in NoLIta, there’s soft-serve frozen yogurt. The flavor changes monthly. For July, delicately seasoned turmeric and cardamom frozen yogurt is swirled into cups and garnished with orange segments and toasted coconut. Dez’s dessert joins a growing list of frozen confections inspired by the Eastern Mediterranean, like the booza served in Williamsburg, Brooklyn and the cinnamon-honey ice cream with bits of baklava at the new Ample Hills outpost in Astoria, Queens.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Frozen Yogurt With a Twist

2018-07-09.abstract: Rabbit’s new stopper also removes foil from a bottle of wine.
2018-07-09.snippet: Rabbit’s new stopper also removes foil from a bottle of wine.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: There are wine stoppers galore out there, and no lack of cutters to make short work of the foil that covers a wine bottle’s cork. Now Rabbit, the company that specializes in wine and bar accessories, has come up with a gadget that handles both. In the foil removal department, it does a better job than most. You put the rubbery cylinder over the neck of the bottle, forcing it down. Squeeze it and turn the bottle. That’s it. A tap releases the foil caught inside.
2018-07-09.headline_main: A Wine Stopper That Does Double Duty

2018-07-09.abstract: Trump makes sexual harassment O.K. again.
2018-07-09.snippet: Trump makes sexual harassment O.K. again.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: Everyone who worried that the #MeToo movement had gone too far can breathe a sigh of relief. It turns out that even if there’s very credible evidence that a man is complicit in sexual harassment and degradation, he can still work at the apex of American politics.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Lie Back and Take It, America

2018-07-09.abstract: New York City had the lowest number of traffic fatalities in a six-month period, which the mayor attributed to the city’s Vision Zero program.
2018-07-09.snippet: New York City had the lowest number of traffic fatalities in a six-month period, which the mayor attributed to the city’s Vision Zero program.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: In the seemingly intractable snarl of New York City traffic, there is a glimmer of hope. In the first six months of this year, the city has had the fewest number of traffic deaths: 81.
2018-07-09.headline_main: A Decline in Traffic Deaths in New York City

2018-07-09.abstract: The retailer, which has more than 28,000 stores worldwide, says the decision will eliminate more than 1 billion straws a year.
2018-07-09.snippet: The retailer, which has more than 28,000 stores worldwide, says the decision will eliminate more than 1 billion straws a year.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: Starbucks will stop using disposable plastic straws by 2020, eliminating more than one billion straws a year, the retailer announced on Monday.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Starbucks to Stop Using Disposable Plastic Straws by 2020

2018-07-09.abstract: Revelations that McKinsey had done more than $20 million in consulting work for Immigration and Customs Enforcement prompted questions from employees.
2018-07-09.snippet: Revelations that McKinsey had done more than $20 million in consulting work for Immigration and Customs Enforcement prompted questions from employees.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: McKinsey & Company, the prominent management consultancy, has stopped working for Immigration and Customs Enforcement after the disclosure last month that the firm had done more than $20 million in consulting work for the agency. The revelation prompted questions from employees at the firm.
2018-07-09.headline_main: McKinsey Ends Work With ICE Amid Furor Over Immigration Policy

2018-07-09.abstract: Nearly a dozen attorneys general asked eight chains for information about whether their contracts kept franchisees from hiring workers away from one another.
2018-07-09.snippet: Nearly a dozen attorneys general asked eight chains for information about whether their contracts kept franchisees from hiring workers away from one another.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: Attorneys general in 10 states are moving to investigate whether a clause in fast-food franchise agreements is preventing workers from switching jobs, locking them into low-paying positions and, some economists say, contributing to widespread wage stagnation in the United States.
2018-07-09.headline_main: ‘No Poach’ Deals for Fast-Food Workers Face Scrutiny by States

2018-07-09.abstract: Rigidly divided by both ideology and party, the court risks losing public legitimacy.
2018-07-09.snippet: Rigidly divided by both ideology and party, the court risks losing public legitimacy.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: President Trump was always going to pick a conservative for the Supreme Court. The only question has been whether to replace Justice Anthony Kennedy with a “business conservative” or a “religious conservative.” No one seriously thought that he would consider a moderate, a liberal or an ideologically ambiguous replacement.
2018-07-09.headline_main: If the Supreme Court Is Nakedly Political, Can It Be Just?

2018-07-09.abstract: Noel Cintron, who drove Donald J. Trump wherever he needed to go, has accused him and the Trump Organization of failing to pay him overtime wages.
2018-07-09.snippet: Noel Cintron, who drove Donald J. Trump wherever he needed to go, has accused him and the Trump Organization of failing to pay him overtime wages.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: For more than 20 years, Noel Cintron was Donald J. Trump’s personal driver, chauffeuring the businessman — before he became the president — wherever he needed to go. Mr. Cintron says that he often worked 55 hours a week and was usually on the job each day at 7 a.m. Though his compensation changed over time, it was, he says, typically in the upper five figures.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Former Driver Sues Trump for More Than 3,000 Hours of Overtime

2018-07-09.abstract: The new restrictions are aimed at forcing Hamas to crack down on kites and balloons that have caused hundreds of fires in Israel.
2018-07-09.snippet: The new restrictions are aimed at forcing Hamas to crack down on kites and balloons that have caused hundreds of fires in Israel.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Unable to thwart the waves of incendiary devices lofted into Israel on kites and birthday balloons from the Gaza Strip, the Israeli government opted for a punitive response on Monday, clamping down on cargo shipments in and out of Gaza in hopes that its rulers would halt the airborne arson themselves.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Unable to Stop Flaming Kites, Israel Moves to Choke Off Gaza Commerce

2018-07-09.abstract: Dean G. Skelos, the ex-majority leader of the State Senate, contradicted previous witnesses’ testimony that he had pressured them to help his son.
2018-07-09.snippet: Dean G. Skelos, the ex-majority leader of the State Senate, contradicted previous witnesses’ testimony that he had pressured them to help his son.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: Dean G. Skelos, the former Senate majority leader in New York, turned his corruption retrial into a plain case of his word against others’ on Monday, as he flatly contradicted the accounts of other witnesses who said he had pressured them to help his son.
2018-07-09.headline_main: In Skelos Retrial, It’s His Word Against Theirs

2018-07-09.abstract: Leaders of opposition parties, who accused Mr. Erdogan of taking an authoritarian turn, refused to stand as the president of Turkey took his oath before Parliament.
2018-07-09.snippet: Leaders of opposition parties, who accused Mr. Erdogan of taking an authoritarian turn, refused to stand as the president of Turkey took his oath before Parliament.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: ANKARA, Turkey — Recep Tayyip Erdogan was sworn in on Monday for a five-year term under a new Constitution that gives Turkey’s president sweeping executive powers. He promptly named his son-in-law finance minister, an appointment that unsettled financial markets and raised new concerns about the concentration of so much power in one politician.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Erdogan Begins New Term and Names His Son-in-Law Finance Minister

2018-07-09.abstract: Mr. Lopate will host an hourlong show weekdays on WBAI, where he began his radio career.

2018-07-09.abstract: Embassies will reopen and flights will resume. The countries’ leaders say, “A new era of peace and friendship has been opened.”

2018-07-09.abstract: Krasnodar, a city in the Russian south, has a huge soccer following and a brand new stadium built by a local entrepreneur, but it doesn’t host a single World Cup game.
2018-07-09.snippet: Krasnodar, a city in the Russian south, has a huge soccer following and a brand new stadium built by a local entrepreneur, but it doesn’t host a single World Cup game.

2018-07-09.headline_main: Russia’s Most Soccer-Mad City, Excluded From the World Cup

2018-07-09.abstract: The move downtown could accelerate the pace of change on the Upper West Side and in Hudson Square, which is being refashioned as a creative district.
2018-07-09.snippet: The move downtown could accelerate the pace of change on the Upper West Side and in Hudson Square, which is being refashioned as a creative district.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: In a move that could speed the transformation of two Manhattan neighborhoods, the Walt Disney Company said on Monday that it would move its New York operations from its longtime home on the Upper West Side to Hudson Square, the downtown neighborhood once known as the printing district now being refashioned into a home for media, advertising, internet and other “creative” companies.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Disney Will Move New York Operations to Lower Manhattan

2018-07-09.abstract: Mr. Knussen was 15 when he led the London Symphony Orchestra in his First Symphony. He matured into a major composer, conductor and mentor.
2018-07-09.snippet: Mr. Knussen was 15 when he led the London Symphony Orchestra in his First Symphony. He matured into a major composer, conductor and mentor.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: The British composer Oliver Knussen — who leapt to fame at 15 conducting the London Symphony Orchestra in his First Symphony, created a wild rumpus of an opera out of Maurice Sendak’s “Where the Wild Things Are,” and championed contemporary composers as a conductor and mentor — died on Sunday in Snape, England. He was 66.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Oliver Knussen, ‘Where the Wild Things Are’ Composer, Dies at 66

2018-07-09.abstract: The resignation of Britain’s foreign secretary could make it easier for Prime Minister Theresa May to reach a more reasonable agreement on Brexit.
2018-07-09.snippet: The resignation of Britain’s foreign secretary could make it easier for Prime Minister Theresa May to reach a more reasonable agreement on Brexit.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: Britain’s foreign secretary and its chief Brexit negotiator caused quite a stir when they resigned within 24 hours of each other because they considered Prime Minister Theresa May’s Brexit proposal too accommodating to Europe. But if her government weathers the resulting storm, their departures could help resolve the tortuous divorce negotiations with the European Union, which are approaching crucial deadlines.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Good Riddance, Boris Johnson

2018-07-09.abstract: As agricultural life is celebrated at county fairs nationwide, this year offers a new variable: President Trump’s global face-off over tariffs.
2018-07-09.snippet: As agricultural life is celebrated at county fairs nationwide, this year offers a new variable: President Trump’s global face-off over tariffs.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: Few things in life are more reliable than the county fair. Evoking decades past, they appear every year — hot and sticky, an emporium of pop-up rides in cartoon colors, fried foods on sticks and contests that bring blue ribbons.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Trade Politics Comes to the County Fair

2018-07-09.abstract: Of soybeans and the meaninglessness of short-term growth.
2018-07-09.snippet: Of soybeans and the meaninglessness of short-term growth.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: According to early indications, recent U.S. economic growth was full of beans.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Trump, Tariffs, Tofu and Tax Cuts

2018-07-09.abstract: Gochujang, frozen arancini and more food trends from the Fancy Food Show.
2018-07-09.snippet: Gochujang, frozen arancini and more food trends from the Fancy Food Show.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: Surveying the Specialty Food Association Summer Fancy Food Show at the Jacob K. Javits Center in Manhattan last week meant enjoying that inevitable sample slice of Iberico ham as well as the latest chocolate truffle (this year it must be healthy, not sinful). Among the more than 200,000 products from 2,400 companies at the trade show were some alluring new items and notable trends. Gochujang, the Korean condiment, has traveled far and wide: Stonewall Kitchen in York, Me., offered a gochujang sauce. Honey was extremely popular, as was jerky, made as frequently from mushrooms and other vegetables as meat. Dried seaweed flakes added a bit of crunch, umami and nutrients when strewn over salads, rice dishes and seafood pasta. Indian flavors — in sauce mixes, seasonings and snacks, including popped water lily seeds — are having their moment. In a related development, turmeric added that touch of “wellness” and gold (but not much flavor) to teas, vinegar, snack puffs and even pasta. A clever item that caught my eye was frozen arancini, ready to heat and eat, from Lundberg Family Farms, the rice growers in Richvale, Calif. They come in several flavors, including gochujang, but alas, not turmeric.
2018-07-09.headline_main: Coming Soon to a Grocery Near You

2018-07-09.abstract: Trump’s ideological sympathies lie more with Putin than with America’s allies.
2018-07-09.snippet: Trump’s ideological sympathies lie more with Putin than with America’s allies.
2018-07-09.lead_paragraph: MADRID — Over the next week, President Trump will visit Europe to call on allies, get in some golf and then meet President Vladimir Putin in Helsinki. He’ll no doubt feel more comfortable with the Russian leader, whom he considers “fine,” than with freeloading NATO partners who, he says, treat Americans as “schmucks.”
2018-07-09.headline_main: The Finlandization of the United States

2018-07-10.abstract: The promises that the conservative legal movement made to the pro-life voters are about to come due.
2018-07-10.snippet: The promises that the conservative legal movement made to the pro-life voters are about to come due.
2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: In the second year of his presidency, Donald Trump has become more and more willing to act Trumpishly rather than deferring to the official wisdom of his party. But with his second Supreme Court nomination, notwithstanding all the head-fakes and reality-television atmospherics, Trump has demonstrated that he’ll take his Trumpishness only so far. It’s one thing to blow up the G-7 with trade wars and make nice with a murderous North Korean despot; it’s quite another to disappoint the D.C. conservative legal establishment. So instead of the dark horses who caught his eye or the female rising star his base and some noisy columnists kept touting, he circled back to the best-known, deepest-resumed, most-vouched-for choice, and gave us Judge Brett Kavanaugh as the nominee.
2018-07-10.headline_main: After Kavanaugh, the Deluge

2018-07-10.abstract: Making the Greek cod-roe dip from scratch greatly improves on the pinkish one found at the store.
2018-07-10.snippet: Making the Greek cod-roe dip from scratch greatly improves on the pinkish one found at the store.
2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: Lately I’ve been going at everything I do in a from-scratch way. My cooking, my thinking, even my writing: I’ve resolved never to just throw a string of popular phrases that weren’t my own — “life hack” or “double down” — onto the plate of my own essay and dare to call it writing. It would feel to me dishonest, like opening a lot of cans from the store, arranging the contents on a dish and then claiming it as cooking rather than reheating.
2018-07-10.headline_main: Not Your Supermarket’s Taramasalata

2018-07-10.abstract: A selection of books published this week; plus, a peek at what our colleagues around the newsroom are reading.
2018-07-10.snippet: A selection of books published this week; plus, a peek at what our colleagues around the newsroom are reading.
2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: GIRLS & BOYS By Dennis Kelly. Performed live by Carey Mulligan. (Audible.) Kelly’s play — part of Audible Studios’ series of original productions staged at the Minetta Lane Theater in New York City’s Greenwich Village — tells the story of a woman who has used manipulation and smarts to win what she has wanted in life. Mulligan’s solo performance, captured here in audio, has been widely praised for its intensity. WILLA OF THE WOOD By Robert Beatty. Read by Emily Rankin. (Listening Library.) Returning to Serafina, his imagined magical world, Beatty presents a new middle-grade series revolving around the character of Willa, a young night-spirit who becomes stranded in the world of the day-folk. DEADLY FORCE By Lawrence O’Donnell. Read by the author. (HarperAudio.) The MSNBC host revisits the 1975 police shooting of an unarmed black man in Boston. The victim’s widow turned to O’Donnell’s father as a lawyer for her case. THE TERRIBLE By Yrsa Daley-Ward. Read by the author and Howard Daley-Ward. (Penguin Audio.) A coming-of-age memoir by the British model and writer who’s achieved fame as an “Instagram poet” of particular lyricism and bracing honesty. INDIANAPOLIS By Lynn Vincent and Sara Vladic. Read by John Bedford Lloyd. (Simon & Schuster Audio.) The sinking of the U.S.S. Indianapolis during World War II was the greatest naval disaster in United States history. Vincent and Vladic go beyond the disaster to describe the nearly 60-year fight to exonerate the ship’s captain.
2018-07-10.headline_main: New & Noteworthy

2018-07-10.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on sharing a parent’s secret with other family members and upholding the values of a liberal education.
2018-07-10.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on sharing a parent’s secret with other family members and upholding the values of a liberal education.
2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: My mother died 18 years ago. Before she died, she told me about an affair of many years’ duration with a family friend. Learning about this made me re-evaluate my parents’ relationship and the decisions they made. My father is also dead, and I have been struggling with whether this information is something my siblings have the right to know, or whether it is not my place to share what she told me. Name Withheld
2018-07-10.headline_main: Should I Tell My Siblings About Mom’s Affair?

2018-07-10.abstract: Once you believe all politicians are crooks, it’s a lot easier to embrace the crook who says he’s on your side.
2018-07-10.snippet: Once you believe all politicians are crooks, it’s a lot easier to embrace the crook who says he’s on your side.
2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: At one of the last rallies of Donald Trump’s 2016 presidential campaign, I found myself speaking with a pair of middle-aged women who emigrated years ago from the Philippines. We got to talking about Rodrigo Duterte, the belligerent strongman who was elected president there six months earlier, and I asked them if they thought Duterte and Trump would get along. “Oh, my gosh!” the first woman said. “Probably — they are the same!”
2018-07-10.headline_main: Americans Think ‘Corruption’ Is Everywhere. Is That Why We Vote for It?

2018-07-10.snippet: Glorious surprises seem to lurk everywhere in this grand Norwegian city.

2018-07-10.headline_main: The 52 Places Traveler: Keep Oslo Weird

2018-07-10.abstract: Her father died ejecting from a B-57 bomber 63 years ago. Last year, she met his navigator who survived the crash.
2018-07-10.snippet: Her father died ejecting from a B-57 bomber 63 years ago. Last year, she met his navigator who survived the crash.
2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: Last September, after 62 years, I finally met the last person to shake my father’s hand, to speak to him, to see him, 7,000 feet in the air. As their B-57 plummeted toward earth, he was the person to whom my father gave the “thumbs up” sign to eject. He was the navigator, my father the pilot. He bailed first; my father followed. He lived; my father did not.
2018-07-10.headline_main: The Last Person to See My Father Alive

2018-07-10.abstract: The Trump administration says it needs the question to enforce voting rights. But a federal judge has given critics the means to search for other motives.
2018-07-10.snippet: The Trump administration says it needs the question to enforce voting rights. But a federal judge has given critics the means to search for other motives.
2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: From the moment it was announced in March, the decision to add a question about citizenship to the 2020 census was described by critics as a ploy to discourage immigrants from filling out the form and improve Republican political fortunes. The Commerce Department, which made the decision, insisted that sound policy, not politics, was its sole motivation.
2018-07-10.headline_main: Why Was a Citizenship Question Put on the Census? ‘Bad Faith,’ a Judge Suggests

2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: Xiyue Wang could easily never have gone to Iran. He was a graduate student at Princeton, researching similarities across regional governments in 19th-century inner Asia. His work touched on neither the United States’ Iran policy nor any Iranian political reality less than a hundred years old. He initially planned to use the archives in Turkmenistan, but Turkmenistan denied him a visa.
2018-07-10.headline_main: Her Husband Was a Princeton Graduate Student. Then He Was Taken Prisoner in Iran.

2018-07-10.snippet: At women-only wine tastings, these beverage industry professionals can show off and hone their strongest sense, without being undermined by male colleagues.

A group of women swirled the red wine in their glasses, inhaled its scent, took careful sips and — in not-quite-happy-hour fashion — spat the liquid out into containers. Then they took notes.

2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Even before Justice Anthony M. Kennedy announced his retirement, Judicial Crisis Network, a conservative advocacy group, had reserved more than two dozen internet domain names — one for each candidate on President Trump’s list of potential Supreme Court nominees. The idea, said Carrie Severino, the group’s chief counsel, was to create a website template: “ConfirmBlank.com.”
2018-07-10.headline_main: Conservative and Liberal Groups Gird for Battle Over Kavanaugh

2018-07-10.abstract: In representing the porn star Stormy Daniels, the lawyer thinks he can bring down a president — one cable-news appearance at a time.
2018-07-10.snippet: In representing the porn star Stormy Daniels, the lawyer thinks he can bring down a president — one cable-news appearance at a time.
2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: The attorney Michael Avenatti stands just under six feet tall, with blatant blue eyes and thinning hair he shaves down to stubble, exposing the crumpled vein at his left temple. Before February, when he agreed to represent Stephanie Clifford — the pornographic film performer better known as Stormy Daniels — in her legal battle with the president of the United States, Avenatti was in the best shape of his life: 185 pounds, 9 percent body fat. The ever-expanding pressures of the case have meant less time at the gym, and in recent months he has lost some muscle weight. But his cheeks and chin remain Cubist in their geometry, and in motion, head lowered and shoulders hunched, he still has the bearing of a light-heavyweight brawler.
2018-07-10.headline_main: The Fast and Furious Michael Avenatti

2018-07-10.abstract: A former Navy diving officer who is now a New York Times reporter sheds light on the obstacles to guiding the children and their coach out of a flooded cave complex.
2018-07-10.snippet: A former Navy diving officer who is now a New York Times reporter sheds light on the obstacles to guiding the children and their coach out of a flooded cave complex.
2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: Rescue operations reached a successful climax at the Tham Luang Cave complex in northern Thailand on Tuesday, where divers pulled the last trapped members of the Wild Boars soccer team to safety. Twelve young team members and their coach had been trapped in the flooded cave complex in Chiang Rai Province since June 23.

2018-07-10.abstract: Dungan cuisine arrives in Brooklyn, a sixth branch of Seamore’s, and other restaurant news.
2018-07-10.snippet: Dungan cuisine arrives in Brooklyn, a sixth branch of Seamore’s, and other restaurant news.
2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: First, you eat. In early October, the dining facilities at the Philadelphia Museum of Art, a neo-Classical landmark built in 1928, will be the first component of the Frank Gehry-led redesign of the museum’s interior to open to the public. Mr. Gehry was selected for the renovation in 2006, but the wheels for the master plan didn’t start turning until 2010. (The whole project will be completed by 2020.) A 76-seat restaurant called Stir, to be run by Starr Catering, which came up with the restaurant’s name, will be warmly wood-paneled in Douglas fir, with a ceiling that undulates, Gehry-style. Central to the ceiling is a gridlike sculpture of curved crisscrossed slats and beams.  Mr. Gehry’s contribution to the restaurant includes the tables and chairs, but not the tableware. The chef Mark Tropea, a former chef for residents of 15 Central Park West, an apartment tower in New York, will preside over the open kitchen. He plans to offer seasonal fare with strong local connections, like Kennett Square mushrooms, Barnegat scallops and a burger topped with Lancaster Cheddar. A new, enlarged cafeteria, also run by Starr Catering, is part of the plan. The dining options do not have an outside entrance, so museum admission is required for entry. “We envision it as part of a total museum experience,” Gail Harrity, the museum’s chief operating officer, wrote in an email.  Stir will open only during museum hours, so just lunch and brunch will be served; the cafeteria will be open from morning until late afternoon.
2018-07-10.headline_main: Stir, in Philadelphia Museum of Art, Prepares for October Opening

2018-07-10.abstract: To fight signs of fatigue, skin-care professionals turn to everything from lymphatic massages to chilled tea masks.
2018-07-10.snippet: To fight signs of fatigue, skin-care professionals turn to everything from lymphatic massages to chilled tea masks.
2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: When you’re tired, your whole body feels it — but your eyes really show it. According to the French-born, New York-based facialist Isabelle Bellis, that has a lot to do with the composition of the skin around your eyes, which is naturally thin and predisposed to retain water in the form of puffy under-eye bags. Its translucent quality easily reveals dark circles, fine lines and dullness. Add to the mix late nights, stress and other compounding factors, and it’s not hard to appear worse for wear.
2018-07-10.headline_main: How to Look Well Rested (Even When You’re Not)

2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: The New York City identification card program was supposed to offer protection to undocumented immigrants, allowing them to engage with city agencies and move freely through the five boroughs. But two recent episodes show that the cards can also be a liability, offering a false sense of security in interactions with federal officials that can leave cardholders in detention.
2018-07-10.headline_main: The IDs Were Meant to Protect Immigrants. Are They a Liability?

2018-07-10.abstract: The most promising political turf in 2018 isn’t on the left.
2018-07-10.snippet: The most promising political turf in 2018 isn’t on the left.
2018-07-10.lead_paragraph: Enough about the Freedom Caucus. Enough about the Democratic Socialists of America. They’re flamboyant players in our political debate, but they’re extremes: More politicians — and most Americans — occupy the expansive territory in between. That’s where the pivotal races in 2018 are being fought. And if Democrats take back the House, it’s where any legislation with a prayer of getting through Congress will be hammered out.
2018-07-10.headline_main: The Center Is Sexier Than You Think

2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: At the end of “you & me,” the new show from the Swiss mime troupe Mummenschanz, you will applaud. That applause may feel a little strange: Are you doing it for the human performers, or for the creatures they have conjured out of skeins of plastic and lumps of foam, or for the passion and drive that have kept this generous, sui generis company producing giddy symbolism for more than 40 years? And is it weird that a mime show is kicking off a mild ontological crisis?

2018-07-11.abstract: Tech companies have changed the world by building answers to obvious questions — but now the obvious, pressing questions are about them.
2018-07-11.snippet: Tech companies have changed the world by building answers to obvious questions — but now the obvious, pressing questions are about them.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: In start-up lore, no figure is more venerated than the tech-world founder. No mere entrepreneur, the founder is unique, sitting above the categories other people might use to order the society around them. In fact, the personage is cast as a sort of revolutionary, proposing big solutions to questions nobody else is even thinking to ask — less often because the questions are too complicated or obscure than because they’re too obvious, too expansive.

2018-07-11.abstract: The worst thing you can do is panic and lift your face up.
2018-07-11.snippet: The worst thing you can do is panic and lift your face up.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: “To do any dive, you need to get acquainted with being upside down,” says Greg Louganis, a four-time Olympic gold medalist in diving. Start at the edge of the pool. Once comfortable, move up to the diving board and to trickier moves like the swan dive. Beginners often balk at the idea of entering the water with the crown of the head down. The worst thing you can do is panic and lift your face up. “You’ll belly-flop,” Louganis says.
2018-07-11.headline_main: How to Swan-Dive

Quite happily, if a recent visit to their Gramercy Park apartment is any measure. Their telegenic union may be a lesson in overcoming the orthodoxies that divide us.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Margaret Hoover and John Avlon on their Post-Partisan Marriage

2018-07-11.abstract: The actor on ownership, policing and his transition from theater to TV.
2018-07-11.snippet: The actor on ownership, policing and his transition from theater to TV.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: One theme of your new movie “Blindspotting,” which you co-wrote and co-star in, is gentrification in your hometown, Oakland, Calif. How do you feel about gentrifiers? I think I’ve been a gentrifier everywhere I have lived since I left Oakland, so it’s a thing that I’m struggling with, too. When I moved to New York, I moved to Washington Heights, because it’s where I could afford. Moving into any neighborhood, there are choices you make. You have an opportunity to learn about what has been there and to understand that you’re not an expert in the place, or to not pay any attention to what was there before. It’s a complicated relationship because everybody’s in love with the place, but there’s a weird discussion to be had over ownership. New folks are buying up stuff, and they feel a sense of ownership because they have papers that say they own a thing. But who has ownership over the culture of a city?
2018-07-11.headline_main: Daveed Diggs Wants to Talk About Gentrifiers

2018-07-11.abstract: The case for being a slob.
2018-07-11.snippet: The case for being a slob.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: My mother, to whom I owe any diligence or self-reliance I may possess, is a sworn enemy of dust and an apostle of the hospital corner — the sort of person who blanches at the sight of dirty laundry and yells indignantly about abandoned cups. I am not; I am a slob with a hoarder’s affinity for trash, and when we lived together, my habits rendered my mother apoplectic with rage. My clothes exploded from every drawer; soda cans, paper bags, wrappers, Walgreens receipts and spent tubes of makeup were sprinkled over my belongings like powdered sugar on French toast. My bedroom was my rubbish kingdom and my sanctuary. This, I argued, was the lifestyle that best enabled me to perform, creatively and intellectually.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Letter of Recommendation: Mess

2018-07-11.abstract: The president calls it a bad deal. In fact it’s our best defense in a dangerous 21st century.

2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump prepared for this week’s NATO summit by doing what no president had done before — making a case that the alliance is a bad deal for the American people. Last week in Great Falls, Mont., he said that he had told Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, “I don’t know how much protection we get by protecting you.” Mr. Trump has been even tougher on the European Union, branding it “as bad as Nafta” and adding, “Sometimes our worst enemies are our so-called friends.”
2018-07-11.headline_main: What America Gets Out of NATO

2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: ADELANTO, Calif. — Moisés Valentín, a pastor at the Christian and Missionary Alliance, and I drove two hours outside of Los Angeles, to the middle of nowhere, high in the Mojave Desert. There, surrounded by sagebrush scrub and crowned in concertina wire, was the Adelanto Detention Facility, the nation’s largest prison for adult immigrants. Many of the people detained there are seeking asylum, running less toward the American dream than away from a Central American nightmare.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Do You Care About the Rule of Law? Then Act Like It

2018-07-11.snippet: Mr. Phoenix plays the disabled alcoholic cartoonist John Callahan in Gus Van Sant’s cleverly volatile biopic.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: If you’ve ever hung out with an incorrigible drunk, then you’ll immediately appreciate the dramatic beats of “Don’t Worry, He Won’t Get Far on Foot,” Gus Van Sant’s cleverly volatile, infuriatingly random take on the disabled alcoholic cartoonist John Callahan. Self-pitying or smug, jaunty or crestfallen, callous or contrite, the movie’s fitful tone is fully yoked to Joaquin Phoenix’s sodden-to-sober lead performance.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Review: Joaquin Phoenix Treks the Long Road to Sobriety in ‘Don’t Worry’

2018-07-11.abstract: With “Head Over Heels” in previews, we looked at how five Go-Go’s songs evolved into musical-theater numbers.
2018-07-11.snippet: With “Head Over Heels” in previews, we looked at how five Go-Go’s songs evolved into musical-theater numbers.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Since bursting onto the Los Angeles scene in 1978, the Go-Go’s have gone through the highs and lows common to rock bands: No. 1 hits and undervalued deep cuts, hard partying and rehab, splits and reunions. No wonder the all-female new wave group’s members have long fielded, and rejected, offers to dramatize their story.
2018-07-11.headline_main: How Broadway Got the Beat: The Go-Go’s in 5 Songs

Some studies have tied extended screen time to distraction in classrooms, sleep deprivation and depression.

2018-07-11.abstract: An heir to the tradition of Pierre Franey, our new columnist has an unfussy recipe for sheet-pan trout.
2018-07-11.snippet: An heir to the tradition of Pierre Franey, our new columnist has an unfussy recipe for sheet-pan trout.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Good morning. Alison Roman is a cook and author who has contributed occasional recipes to NYT Cooking for a few years now. Today I come to you with great news: She’ll be doing so regularly from this point forward, as a columnist for The Times. Read her debut, about butterflied fish and her mom and unfussy cooking, and then cook her great recipe for sheet-pan trout (above). Remember the old “60-Minute Gourmet” columns of Pierre Franey? I think Alison is an heir to that tradition, and I hope you’ll make her welcome.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Alison Roman! Alison Roman!

2018-07-11.snippet: Most Americans choose a political party before choosing whether to join a religious community.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: At first glance, President Trump’s nomination of Judge Brett Kavanaugh for the Supreme Court would seem a perfect reminder of why so many religious white Americans vote Republican: to promote conservative moral values. Religious values. Their values. The values that — the story goes — devout white Protestants and Catholics want to see in Washington.
2018-07-11.headline_main: When Politicians Determine Your Religious Beliefs

2018-07-11.snippet: A brief overview of the highs and lows for England’s national football team.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Despite being one of the two oldest national soccer teams in the world, England’s national team didn’t participate in the World Cup until 1950, as they had departed FIFA in 1928 and did not rejoin the organization until 1946. They have qualified for the World Cup 15 times, making it to the quarterfinals seven times and coming in fourth place in the semifinals in 1990.
2018-07-11.headline_main: England Soccer Team Ready to Exorcise Ghosts of Failures Past in 2018 Semifinals

2018-07-11.snippet: Kevin Anderson rallied past Federer for a 2-6, 6-7 (5), 7-5, 6-4, 13-11 victory. Five hours later, Rafael Nadal survived a five-setter against Juan Martín del Potro.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: WIMBLEDON, England — Wimbledon runs on nostalgia, and it has been a year brimming with anniversaries. The tournament is commemorating its 150th, Open tennis is commemorating its 50th, and Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal are commemorating their 10th after their final for the ages here in 2008.
2018-07-11.headline_main: On a Wild Day at Wimbledon, Federer Exits and Nadal Hangs On

2018-07-11.abstract: Offred makes a bold decision. But is it believable? Or smart?
2018-07-11.snippet: Offred makes a bold decision. But is it believable? Or smart?
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: How long can “The Handmaid’s Tale” go on like this? The show has had a successful season, by some measures: After a first season that covered the entirety of Margaret Atwood’s novel, the writers moved past a few excessively brutal early episodes to tell an original and often gripping story. Scripts examined the geopolitics of Gilead and psychoanalyzed the heretofore inscrutable Serena Joy. The acting remained superb. But, by the time Offred got her second chance to escape, in Episode 11, the plot was devolving into an exercise in Sisyphean futility.
2018-07-11.headline_main: ‘The Handmaid’s Tale’ Season 2 Finale Recap: Burning Down the House

2018-07-11.abstract: As Beate Zschäpe’s group killed workers with immigrant backgrounds, investigators failed to realize that right-wing extremists were to blame.

2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — The sole surviving member of one of Germany’s deadliest neo-Nazi terrorist groups was sentenced to life imprisonment on Wednesday, in the culmination of a saga that has shamed the country’s security services, strained its relationship with Turkey and fueled accusations of institutional racism.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Neo-Nazi Terrorist Jailed for Life in Case That Shamed Germany’s Spies

2018-07-11.abstract: A neuroscience education program for those with back or neck pain led to better physical and mental health.

2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Learning a bit of neuroscience may provide some relief from pain.

2018-07-11.abstract: Winkler, a dominant force in show jumping for decades, won seven Olympic medals. His best performances were astride a singular mare named Halla.
2018-07-11.snippet: Winkler, a dominant force in show jumping for decades, won seven Olympic medals. His best performances were astride a singular mare named Halla.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Hans Günter Winkler, a German equestrian who was a dominant force in show jumping for decades, competing at every Olympic Games from 1956 through 1976 and winning seven medals, died on Monday in Warendorf, Germany. He was 91.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Hans Günter Winkler, Olympic Champion Equestrian, Dies at 91

2018-07-11.abstract: An exhibition in Germany is proposing a different way to organize artifacts in a postcolonial era. It’s ambitious, sweeping — and just a little bit demented.
2018-07-11.snippet: An exhibition in Germany is proposing a different way to organize artifacts in a postcolonial era. It’s ambitious, sweeping — and just a little bit demented.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: HAMBURG, Germany — When Europeans of the 18th and 19th centuries established their grandest museums, each building meant to unite the world’s cultural heritage under a single roof, they had no doubt as to who should explain it all: themselves. They took a Eurocentric view, categorizing the spoils of colonial enterprise by nation and region, splitting art from craft, and nature from culture.
2018-07-11.headline_main: A New Type of Museum for an Age of Migration

2018-07-11.abstract: Jada Yuan, who is circling the globe this year for The Times, packs a lot of tech for her journeys. A lot.
2018-07-11.snippet: Jada Yuan, who is circling the globe this year for The Times, packs a lot of tech for her journeys. A lot.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? Jada Yuan, who is crisscrossing the globe as The Times’s 52 Places Traveler, discussed the tech she’s using.
2018-07-11.headline_main: How the 52 Places Traveler Stays Charged While Chronicling the World

2018-07-11.abstract: The police in Florida said on Wednesday that they had arrested one of two gunmen in the 20-year-old musician’s death, but were still seeking an additional assailant.

2018-07-11.abstract: The transformation of a deep sea mollusk is comparable to an average person growing as much as 60 feet tall with a giant sac of bacteria filling its guts.
2018-07-11.snippet: The transformation of a deep sea mollusk is comparable to an average person growing as much as 60 feet tall with a giant sac of bacteria filling its guts.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: In the ocean off the coast of Antarctica, a snail lives around scorching hydrothermal vents. Its name is Gigantopelta chessoia. From the outside, it looks like any other shelled slug. But on the inside, something strange is happening, scientists report in Proceedings of the Royal Society B, like no metamorphosis ever observed in any other animal on the planet.
2018-07-11.headline_main: This Snail Goes Through Metamorphosis. Then It Never Has to Eat Again.

2018-07-11.headline_main: China Wants High-Tech Cars. German Automakers Are Eager to Help.

2018-07-11.abstract: The interest of Angela Merkel in China’s human rights record, and her personal touch, helped secure the release of Liu Xia, the widow of Liu Xiaobo.

2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Until the door of the plane that took her to freedom in Germany closed, they hovered around. They escorted her on the 90-minute car ride from her apartment to the airport. They walked her through a special departure area.
2018-07-11.headline_main: How Germany Won Freedom for the Widow of China’s Most Famous Dissident

2018-07-11.abstract: Croatia, in their third straight game that went to extra time, rode its resiliency to a semifinal win and ended England’s effervescent run in this tournament.
2018-07-11.snippet: Croatia, in their third straight game that went to extra time, rode its resiliency to a semifinal win and ended England’s effervescent run in this tournament.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Their legs had stopped working long before the end. Their muscles ached, their lungs heaved, their bodies creaked and groaned. Croatia’s players had hit their limits and traveled beyond them, yet again. They had drained themselves of adrenaline. They had passed deep into the red, into the pain.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Croatia Digs Deeper, Burying England’s World Cup Dreams

2018-07-11.abstract: Twitter will begin removing tens of millions of suspicious accounts from follower numbers, signaling a major new effort to fight fraud and restore trust on the platform.

2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: For some time, status in the first world has not been signaled just with expensive clothes and designer handbags, but also with so-called elevated versions of everyday items: an elegant pour-over coffee kit in place of a humble Mr. Coffee machine; dinky house ferns replaced by exotic Monstera plants; and in recent infamy, drinking straws and paper clips from Tiffany.
2018-07-11.headline_main: When Did Soap, Once Simple, Get So Complicated?

2018-07-11.abstract: The first American production of “Fiddler on the Roof” in the language of the shtetl means training actors to hit the inflections, not just the notes.
2018-07-11.snippet: The first American production of “Fiddler on the Roof” in the language of the shtetl means training actors to hit the inflections, not just the notes.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Yiddish was the language spoken by Tevye the milk peddler and the other shtetl characters depicted in the stories that inspired “Fiddler on the Roof,” yet in this country the landmark musical has never been performed professionally in that savory and supple tongue. Until now.

2018-07-11.snippet: The second season gave in to the Hulu series’s most tedious instincts, substituting slow stares and endless montage sequences for any actual development.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: When “The Handmaid’s Tale” had its premiere on Hulu in 2017, it was a mere three months after the inauguration — tensions were high, nerves raw. The election of a president who had been, among other things, caught on tape making gleefully misogynistic remarks inspired a credible panic in some women and others who feared their civil rights might soon be further jeopardized.
2018-07-11.headline_main: ‘The Handmaid’s Tale’ Season 2 Is Brutal and Not Much Else

2018-07-11.abstract: The average debt load is flattening out, a new analysis of federal loan data shows, but college isn’t getting cheaper. Many students are hitting their borrowing cap, and parents are filling the gap.
2018-07-11.snippet: The average debt load is flattening out, a new analysis of federal loan data shows, but college isn’t getting cheaper. Many students are hitting their borrowing cap, and parents are filling the gap.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: It’s a sign of the times: A new game show, “Paid Off,” debuted on Tuesday offering winners not dream vacations or new cars, but a pile of cash to help lessen the crushing weight of their student debt.

2018-07-11.abstract: Chipped rocks found in western China indicate that human ancestors ventured from Africa earlier than previously believed.
2018-07-11.snippet: Chipped rocks found in western China indicate that human ancestors ventured from Africa earlier than previously believed.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: The oldest stone tools outside Africa have been discovered in western China, scientists reported on Wednesday. Made by ancient members of the human lineage, called hominins, the chipped rocks are estimated to be as much as 2.1 million years old.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Archaeologists in China Discover the Oldest Stone Tools Outside Africa

2018-07-11.abstract: The performer formerly known as the Rock proves again that he can surmount even a pile of recycled genre standards.
2018-07-11.snippet: The performer formerly known as the Rock proves again that he can surmount even a pile of recycled genre standards.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: At one point in the insistently, nay, proudly ridiculous thriller “Skyscraper” the hero played by Dwayne Johnson assures the audience what it’s known from the start: “This is stupid.” It’s hard not to wonder if the writer-director Rawson Marshall Thurber built the entire movie around this redundant truism. And why not? All he had to do was pad it with some recycling, bank on his relationship with Mr. Johnson — they worked together on “Central Intelligence,” as mocking a title as Hollywood has produced — and Mr. Thurber had his elevator pitch: “The Towering Inferno” meets “Die Hard” but in China. Box-office domination was guaranteed as soon as the seven-figure deal was signed.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Review: In ‘Skyscraper,’ Dwayne Johnson Scales a Tower of Clichés

2018-07-11.abstract: The U.S. service member killed in Afghanistan on July 7 in an insider attack was assigned to a Guardian Angel unit. Here’s what that means.
2018-07-11.snippet: The U.S. service member killed in Afghanistan on July 7 in an insider attack was assigned to a Guardian Angel unit. Here’s what that means.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Cpl. Joseph Maciel’s death in southern Afghanistan on July 7 was not a result of a pitched firefight with insurgents or a car packed with explosives, but of an Afghan security force member who belonged to the very group Maciel was sent to fight alongside.
2018-07-11.headline_main: U.S. Soldier Killed in Afghanistan Was Part of Guardian Angel Unit

2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Human rights protesters were demonstrating outside the Joyce Theater on Tuesday night. The company appearing was from Israel — Batsheva’s junior troupe, the Young Ensemble. 2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The Getty Museum has long been a destination for fans of illuminated manuscripts, with a trove including Christian prayer books from the Middle Ages. Now it also owns a rare Jewish illuminated manuscript from 1296, known as the Rothschild Pentateuch.

2018-07-11.abstract: Once again, the Spanish player David Marrero was involved in a doubles match at a major that attracted suspicious betting patterns.

2018-07-11.abstract: The invasive flower is aptly named, filling the vacant lots of the city with a clean, intoxicating smell.
2018-07-11.snippet: The invasive flower is aptly named, filling the vacant lots of the city with a clean, intoxicating smell.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Just as the first truly hot summer days seem to warp the city’s hard-edge structures, a few blessed flowers emerge to make the evenings worth waiting for. Some, like linden, are native; others, like honeysuckle, are not. For some unknown reason, almost all are better known than soapwort.
2018-07-11.headline_main: That Laundry-Fresh Scent of Wild Soapwort

2018-07-11.abstract: In “Hotel Kid,” Stephen Lewis writes of his room-service lifestyle at the Hotel Taft (now the Michelangelo), where his family moved in 1931.
2018-07-11.snippet: In “Hotel Kid,” Stephen Lewis writes of his room-service lifestyle at the Hotel Taft (now the Michelangelo), where his family moved in 1931.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: The Hotel Taft was once the biggest hotel in Midtown Manhattan, but it never had 2,000 rooms, as advertised, and to claim that it was located both in Times Square and at Radio City (as the matchbooks and postcards did) was a stretch.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Eloise Who? The True Story of Growing Up in a Manhattan Hotel

2018-07-11.abstract: A new study suggests that a horse’s exhalations may signal contentment or pleasure, rather than a simple clearing of the animal’s nasal passages.
2018-07-11.snippet: A new study suggests that a horse’s exhalations may signal contentment or pleasure, rather than a simple clearing of the animal’s nasal passages.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: No one can talk to a horse, of course. But a new study set out to find whether horses are trying to tell us something when they snort.

2018-07-11.abstract: A fossil found in Argentina that is more than 200 million years old suggests the most giant of dinosaurs existed earlier than paleontologists believed.
2018-07-11.snippet: A fossil found in Argentina that is more than 200 million years old suggests the most giant of dinosaurs existed earlier than paleontologists believed.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: No creatures ever stomped across the planet quite like the creatures scientists call sauropodomorphs.
2018-07-11.headline_main: New Clues to How the Biggest Dinosaurs Got So Big

2018-07-11.abstract: The president waged a harsh attack on Germany at the NATO meeting, saying it was “captive” of Russia. The chancellor, weakened at home, reacted mildly but pointedly.
2018-07-11.snippet: The president waged a harsh attack on Germany at the NATO meeting, saying it was “captive” of Russia. The chancellor, weakened at home, reacted mildly but pointedly.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — President Trump wasted no time. NATO’s secretary general, Jens Stoltenberg, could barely finish the greetings at Wednesday’s breakfast when Mr. Trump launched into a clearly planned attack.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Trump vs. Merkel: Blistering Salvo Meets Quiet Rejoinder

2018-07-11.abstract: An estimated 6.6 million Syrians are displaced within their own country. One man's videos provide a rare look inside a camp for those who have fled their homes.
2018-07-11.snippet: An estimated 6.6 million Syrians are displaced within their own country. One man's videos provide a rare look inside a camp for those who have fled their homes.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: When Syrian government forces retook control of Rami al-Sayyed’s Damascus suburb in April, he and others who had supported opposition fighters faced a choice. “Either stay in regime areas and face the worst,” he said, “or leave and survive.”
2018-07-11.headline_main: Memories Lost and Futures on Hold: A Look Inside a Camp for Syria’s Displaced

2018-07-11.abstract: The deputy attorney general asked each of the nation’s 93 United States attorneys to provide up to three prosecutors to review the documents of President Trump’s Supreme Court pick.
2018-07-11.snippet: The deputy attorney general asked each of the nation’s 93 United States attorneys to provide up to three prosecutors to review the documents of President Trump’s Supreme Court pick.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Rod J. Rosenstein, the deputy attorney general, has asked federal prosecutors to help review the government documents of Judge Brett M. Kavanaugh, President Trump’s Supreme Court nominee, according to a letter obtained by The New York Times on Wednesday.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Rosenstein Asks Prosecutors to Help With Kavanaugh Papers in Unusual Request

2018-07-11.abstract: Introducing the sleep dress, the sartorial solution for the summer sloth.
2018-07-11.snippet: Introducing the sleep dress, the sartorial solution for the summer sloth.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Summer makes us lazy. It isn’t our imagination. It’s science. Studies have been published in recent years showing that high heat and humidity have an impact on our concentration and productivity levels.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Wear Your Nightie Out

2018-07-11.abstract: David Longstreth turns away from the electronic sounds of his last album, embracing warmer tones on an LP that celebrates love while grappling with political dread.
2018-07-11.snippet: David Longstreth turns away from the electronic sounds of his last album, embracing warmer tones on an LP that celebrates love while grappling with political dread.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: David Longstreth — the songwriter behind Dirty Projectors — is a man who’s rapturously in love for most of his eighth studio album, “Lamp Lit Prose.” Within the Dirty Projectors catalog, this is the joyful rebound from the bitter breakup songs of “Dirty Projectors,” the album he released in February 2017. But it also faces a bigger question: How should an artist respond to what America has become?
2018-07-11.headline_main: Dirty Projectors Find Love in Dystopian Times on ‘Lamp Lit Prose’

2018-07-11.abstract: The lab at Alphabet, Google’s parent company, has graduated two projects — one to build delivery drones and another making internet-beaming balloons — into independent businesses.
2018-07-11.snippet: The lab at Alphabet, Google’s parent company, has graduated two projects — one to build delivery drones and another making internet-beaming balloons — into independent businesses.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Google’s efforts to build delivery drones and internet-beaming balloons are no longer just science projects.
2018-07-11.headline_main: Google’s Parent Births New Businesses: Balloons and Drones

2018-07-11.abstract: In “The Fall of Wisconsin,” Dan Kaufman shows how the Tea Party’s philosophy has triumphed in a state long known for its progressive traditions.
2018-07-11.snippet: In “The Fall of Wisconsin,” Dan Kaufman shows how the Tea Party’s philosophy has triumphed in a state long known for its progressive traditions.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Hardcore conservatives adore infrastructure, and they’re phenomenally good at building it. This isn’t to say they’re necessarily committed to constructing roads and bridges and dams; it’s the infrastructure of their own movement — the one that has helped Republican politicians seize power in state legislatures over the past decade — that inspires their real dedication.
2018-07-11.headline_main: How Conservatives Bet Big on Wisconsin and Won

2018-07-11.abstract: A year after a public relations debacle over pay disparities between its male and female stars, the British broadcaster released salary data that showed halting progress in wage equity.
2018-07-11.snippet: A year after a public relations debacle over pay disparities between its male and female stars, the British broadcaster released salary data that showed halting progress in wage equity.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: A year after a public relations debacle over wide pay disparities between its male and female stars, the BBC on Wednesday released a new  list detailing how much it pays its top talent. And while the list suggested that there had been some progress, the reality remains somewhat gloomy for women.
2018-07-11.headline_main: BBC Closes Gender Pay Gap, but Men Are Still Its 12 Highest-Paid Stars

2018-07-11.abstract: Ira Gershenhorn routinely swims in the sometimes unsanitary Hudson River off Manhattan, to show people that, aside from the sewage, the water’s great.
2018-07-11.snippet: Ira Gershenhorn routinely swims in the sometimes unsanitary Hudson River off Manhattan, to show people that, aside from the sewage, the water’s great.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Ira Gershenhorn was in a full sweat by the time he bicycled up to his swimming spot on a recent sultry afternoon.
2018-07-11.headline_main: The Hudson Swimmer

2018-07-11.abstract: As head of the camera team for the Voyager mission, Dr. Smith was humanity’s tour guide to the solar system.
2018-07-11.snippet: As head of the camera team for the Voyager mission, Dr. Smith was humanity’s tour guide to the solar system.
2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: Bradford Smith, who extended humanity’s vision to look boldly where no eyes had ever looked as head of the camera team for the Voyager mission, hopscotching from one weird world to the next across the solar system and discovering prospects for alien life, died on July 3 at his home in Santa Fe, N.M. He was 86.

2018-07-11.lead_paragraph: There are few more poignant, exasperating creatures than teenage girls. (I speak from personal experience.) And rarely are they as heart-pangingly real as the girl fumbling through the sharp, smart comedy “Eighth Grade.” Like a lot of people, Kayla (the wonderful Elsie Fisher), spends a lot of time tethered to a cellphone that serves as her touchingly imperfect portal to the world. Day and deep into night, she scrolls through screen after screen of images — celebrities, cartoons, celebrity cartoons, stranger selfies — sprinkled with hashtags, online handles, candy-colored effects and emojis.

2018-07-12.abstract: On the bucolic North Fork of Long Island: oysters, wineries, country roads and water views all over the place.
2018-07-12.snippet: On the bucolic North Fork of Long Island: oysters, wineries, country roads and water views all over the place.
2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: Two days bracket the high season in Greenport, a centuries-old fishing village on the North Fork of Long Island: the last day of school, late in June, and Tumbleweed Tuesday, as shopkeepers and farm stand workers call the day after Labor Day. Spring, fall and the starkly beautiful winter offer their own pleasures on the lush vineyard-rich North Fork, but in summer that long spindle of land, and especially Greenport, with a population of about 2,000, bustles. The harbor fills with fishing boats, sails are hoisted, weekenders spill from train, ferries, cars and buses. The lures: local oysters, farm-to-table restaurants, wineries, country roads to stroll or bicycle along and water views all over the place.
2018-07-12.headline_main: 36 Hours in Greenport, N.Y. (and Beyond)

2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: Domestic workers are, in a sense, the original gig workers. Before smartphones and the internet, nannies, housecleaners and elder care workers have had to juggle multiple schedules, clients and skills and manage their work independently. And they have long faced the challenges associated with the gig economy: precarious employment, low pay and a lack of workplace protections.

2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: They were just a couple of unmarked doors, and they were always locked. The soft sounds of voices and the clinking of crockery as meals were prepared drifted through to the section of the elegant Belgrade apartment where the director Mila Turajlic grew up. Only much later would she learn what lay behind those doors, and why. Yet their eventual opening would liberate more than just the two rooms carved off and allotted to strangers by a long-ago government: It would help one woman decide it was time to pass the political baton.
2018-07-12.headline_main: Review: In ‘The Other Side of Everything,’ a Belgrade Apartment Symbolizes Upheaval

He says that not all reporters got the story wrong. “Almost everybody did,” she replies, “except for Knight Ridder.”
2018-07-12.headline_main: Review: In ‘Shock and Awe,’ Journalists Expose Gaps in Case for Iraq War

2018-07-12.abstract: This documentary commands attention as an object lesson in the banality of evil.
2018-07-12.snippet: This documentary commands attention as an object lesson in the banality of evil.
2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: “Path of Blood” gives a director credit to Jonathan Hacker, who wrote a 2015 book of the same title with Thomas Small. But directing isn’t quite accurate. This documentary, which covers events in Saudi Arabia from 2003 to 2009, interweaves videos made by Al Qaeda members there with footage shot by Saudi security forces of raids on terrorist suspects’ safe houses.
2018-07-12.headline_main: Review: ‘Path of Blood’ Presents Terrorists’ Videos

2018-07-12.abstract: Aislinn Clarke’s outraged horror movie sends two priests to investigate a home for fallen women.
2018-07-12.snippet: Aislinn Clarke’s outraged horror movie sends two priests to investigate a home for fallen women.
2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: “Do you know how many of the babies born here had fathers who were Fathers, Father?,” a steely Reverend Mother asks a nosy priest in Aislinn Clarke’s “The Devil’s Doorway.” In the annals of sacrilegious tongue-twisters, that question takes the Communion wafer. But with a location inspired by Ireland’s infamous Magdalene laundries — where, for more than two centuries, religious orders imprisoned so-called fallen women and used them as virtual slaves — this smart but uneven horror movie has little interest in fun.
2018-07-12.headline_main: Review: Sinfulness and Scares Behind ‘The Devil’s Doorway’

2018-07-12.abstract: Dominque Rocher’s feature debut finds new ways to drain all the fun out of flesh-eating monsters.
2018-07-12.snippet: Dominque Rocher’s feature debut finds new ways to drain all the fun out of flesh-eating monsters.
2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: Never underestimate the ability of the French to find deep meaning in the zombie apocalypse. Back in the late 1960s, it was a critic in the Paris-based magazine Cahiers du Cinéma who saw the profound subtext that American reviewers overlooked in George A. Romero’s formative “Night of the Living Dead.” And just when you thought modern portraits of the undead couldn’t become more pretentious, “The Night Eats the World,” Dominque Rocher’s tediously solemn feature debut, finds new ways to drain all the fun out of flesh-eating monsters.
2018-07-12.headline_main: Review: In ‘The Night Eats the World,’ Zombie Apocalypse Now, Again

2018-07-12.abstract: Adam Sandler lends his voice as Dracula again in the third installment of this animated franchise.
2018-07-12.snippet: Adam Sandler lends his voice as Dracula again in the third installment of this animated franchise.
2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: Recently the actor Sandra Bullock said in an interview that “children should review children’s films,” which made me think, “Sure, why not. Save me some work.”
2018-07-12.headline_main: Review: Raising the Stakes With ‘Hotel Transylvania 3: Summer Vacation’

2018-07-12.abstract: Mr. Reeves plays a diamond merchant who falls for a cafe owner in this leaden thriller.
2018-07-12.snippet: Mr. Reeves plays a diamond merchant who falls for a cafe owner in this leaden thriller.
2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: Siberia (the place) is cold, but the sleek kitchen in “Siberia” (the film), might be even colder — all gleaming surfaces that seem almost inhospitable to food. It belongs to the diamond merchant Lucas Hill (an earnest Keanu Reeves), who presumably got into his dangerous business to pay for stuff like his big American kitchen. Or maybe not. His motivations are as cloudy as a cheap gemstone, as he alternates between lethal skill and naïve bumbling in Matthew Ross’s leaden thriller.
2018-07-12.headline_main: Review: Keanu Reeves, Selling Ice in a Dull ‘Siberia’

2018-07-12.abstract: The director Iram Haq translated a personal story to the screen for this domestic kidnapping thriller.
2018-07-12.snippet: The director Iram Haq translated a personal story to the screen for this domestic kidnapping thriller.
2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: When “What Will People Say” begins, Nisha is a bright and beautiful teenager, as much the ideal assimilated daughter of Norway as she is the ideal daughter of her Pakistani immigrant parents. At home, Nisha (the newcomer Maria Mozhdah, in an arresting performance) speaks Urdu and diligently maintains her grades so that she might one day become a doctor. But at school, she is indistinguishable from her Norwegian friends who wear makeup, sneak out of their homes at night and lust after boys while dancing to techno music.
2018-07-12.headline_main: Review: In ‘What Will People Say,’ Tyranny Begins at Home

2018-07-12.abstract: “The Rise and Fall of a Small Film Company,” a made-for-TV movie by Jean-Luc Godard, is having its New York premiere in a new restoration.
2018-07-12.snippet: “The Rise and Fall of a Small Film Company,” a made-for-TV movie by Jean-Luc Godard, is having its New York premiere in a new restoration.
2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: The imposing filmography of Jean-Luc Godard is dotted with many remarkable anomalies and one-offs, including television commercials and music videos. “The Rise and Fall of a Small Film Company,” a shot-on-video picture made in 1986 and having its official New York premiere in a new restoration, is one of the most diverting and substantial of these.
2018-07-12.headline_main: Review: A Godard Film About Making Movies Arrives in New York

2018-07-12.abstract: This documentary about the jazz drummer speaks to the pulse of life.
2018-07-12.snippet: This documentary about the jazz drummer speaks to the pulse of life.
2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: The musician Milford Graves is a rare example of a truly holistic artist. This stunning documentary, directed by Jake Meginsky with the assistance of Neil Young (a musician, but no relation to the rock star) does not offer anything like a conventional biography or career trajectory of the percussionist, who was and continues to be a unique force in jazz.
2018-07-12.headline_main: Review: ‘Milford Graves Full Mantis’ Delivers a Lot of Heart

2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: ARLES, France — The neighborhood looks unremarkable, if a little unkempt: a dollar store, a laundromat, a fashion business with a few other sidelines (“All cellphone bills paid here”). The sky is heavy, the color of pewter; snow blankets the sidewalk. The adverts for the New York Lottery in the grocery store windows are a giveaway. But something is off. What district of New York City is one story high? And can those be pine trees in the background?

2018-07-12.abstract: In deploying his pardon power freely and using the Bible to justify family separation, the president is exactly the sort of ruler that Enlightenment thinkers feared.
2018-07-12.snippet: In deploying his pardon power freely and using the Bible to justify family separation, the president is exactly the sort of ruler that Enlightenment thinkers feared.
2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. — The heartbreaking scenes on the southern border seem a world away from recent presidential pardons. Sobbing children and bereft parents have nothing in common with Joe Arpaio, Dinesh D’Souza and, most recently, the Oregon ranchers Dwight Hammond and his son, Steven, who had been convicted of arson in 2016 and whom President Trump pardoned on Tuesday. Yet both come down to a relationship between justice and mercy that has a long history — and a cautionary moral for the president.
2018-07-12.headline_main: Trump and the Return of Divine Right

2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: My boyfriend and his ex-wife argued about letting their 10-year-old daughter get highlights in her dark hair. My boyfriend wanted her to get them; his ex did not. After much negotiation (and tears from the girl), his ex capitulated, and their daughter’s hair is now colored. The problem: My boyfriend told me that the little girl is dying for me to “notice” her highlights. I haven’t said anything yet. I agree with her mother, and told my boyfriend so. What should I say to the girl?

Even if you don’t normally pay attention to what happens on Capitol Hill, the spectacle of putting a new justice on the nation’s highest court can be hard to resist. 2018-07-12.abstract: The death of the show’s composer, Michael Friedman, makes this musical about loss an accidental and indispensable elegy.
2018-07-12.snippet: The death of the show’s composer, Michael Friedman, makes this musical about loss an accidental and indispensable elegy.
2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: The two-night revival of “Gone Missing” at New York City Center is both a very good show and a very bad, very cosmic joke. Because this documentary song cycle is about loss: of minds, rings, a dog, the hour badly spent. And the irretrievable loss, the one you can hear in pretty much every plink and strum from the onstage band, is the loss of the show’s composer, Michael Friedman, who died a year ago from AIDS-related complications. Which makes “Gone Missing” an accidental and indispensable elegy.
2018-07-12.headline_main: Review: ‘Gone Missing,’ Now a Poignant Reminder of a Life Cut Short

2018-07-12.abstract: The 2017 hurricane killed 70 times more people in Puerto Rico than the official estimate. As relatives of unrecognized victims, how can we begin to heal?
2018-07-12.snippet: The 2017 hurricane killed 70 times more people in Puerto Rico than the official estimate. As relatives of unrecognized victims, how can we begin to heal?
2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: In the video op-ed above, family members of victims of Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico demand the government treat Puerto Ricans with the respect they deserve and better prepare for this year’s hurricane season. In May, a Harvard-funded, household-based survey calculated that the death toll of Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico is likely 70 times greater than the official estimate. The study put the number of deaths at 4,645. This inspired a Puerto Rican journalist, Gloribel Delgado Esquilín, to co-found Proyecto 4645, a social-media-based movement to promote healing for the relatives of unrecognized victims of the hurricane. The project created an installation in front of Puerto Rico’s Capitol with hundreds of the dead’s shoes, calling on the island’s governor to recognize the real magnitude of the devastation.
2018-07-12.headline_main: Hurricane Maria Killed Our Loved Ones. They’re Not Just Statistics.

2018-07-12.lead_paragraph: The thermometer hit 100 two Sundays ago, but that didn’t stop cool-hunting New Yorkers from trekking out to Fort Tilden to see Yayoi Kusama’s “Narcissus Garden.” Some 1,500 infinitely Instagrammable stainless steel balls were installed inside a former train garage, as part of the Rockaway! arts festival. Some attendees used umbrellas to ward off the sun; others wore bikinis. The beach, thankfully, is just over the sand dunes.
