2018-07-26.abstract: “Kanata,” a collaboration with the French theater group Théâtre du Soleil, was canceled Thursday after being criticized for its casting.
2018-07-26.snippet: “Kanata,” a collaboration with the French theater group Théâtre du Soleil, was canceled Thursday after being criticized for its casting.
2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: The Quebec stage director Robert Lepage canceled the production of his theater piece “Kanata” after some of the show’s producers withdrew from the project. Mr. Lepage, who made the announcement on Thursday, and his collaborators in the French theater group Théâtre du Soleil had been criticized for not casting any Indigenous Canadians in the production, which focuses, in part, on the struggles of Indigenous communities in Canada throughout the country’s history.
2018-07-26.headline_main: A Second Robert Lepage Production Canceled After an Outcry

2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — Growing up here in the 1970s, Kyungah Ham would occasionally find propaganda leaflets sent from North Korea via helium balloons. Like her classmates, Ms. Ham turned in the leaflets at school, where she was given a reward for doing a small part in South Korea’s simmering ideological war with its neighbor.
2018-07-26.headline_main: An Artist Unites North and South Korea, Stitch by Stitch

2018-07-26.headline_main: A #MeToo Reckoning in China’s Workplace Amid Wave of Accusations

2018-07-26.snippet: Human rights experts pressed Russian officials over their handling of cases involving torture, including the 2017 beating of a prison inmate that was caught on video.
2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: GENEVA — Russian officials on Thursday pledged to prosecute anyone implicated in a prisoner-abuse scandal, but they failed to convince United Nations human rights experts that their promises signaled a change in official attitudes on torture.
2018-07-26.headline_main: Russia Promises to End Prison Torture. U.N. Experts Are Unconvinced.

2018-07-26.abstract: Some loyal supporters on the left say that Mayor Bill de Blasio has fallen short on fully delivering on several progressive issues.

2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: In his first inaugural address in 2014, Mayor Bill de Blasio invoked the names of legendary reformers, from Fiorello La Guardia to Franklin and Eleanor Roosevelt, and said that in their honor and spirit, he would “commit to a new progressive direction in New York.”
2018-07-26.headline_main: Bill de Blasio Is a Progressive. But Is He Progressive Enough?

2018-07-26.abstract: Stay low in the hull — but keep some body parts visible above the gunwale.
2018-07-26.snippet: Stay low in the hull — but keep some body parts visible above the gunwale.
2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: “Three words: center of gravity,” says James Raffan, former executive director of the Canadian Canoe Museum in Peterborough, Ontario. To avoid capsizing, bodies should stay low in the hull, especially if you intend to make any lateral rocking movements. In a country with more than 60 percent of the world’s lakes, crisscrossed by untold rivers and streams, it’s no wonder that the ability to copulate while floating in a small boat has become a point of national pride. In 1973, the author and historian Pierre Berton was quoted as saying, “A Canadian is somebody who knows how to make love in a canoe.”
2018-07-26.headline_main: How to Have Sex in a Canoe

2018-07-26.abstract: She enlisted in the nursing corps during World War II, not expecting to make a career out of the Navy. But in 1972, she broke a barrier.
2018-07-26.snippet: She enlisted in the nursing corps during World War II, not expecting to make a career out of the Navy. But in 1972, she broke a barrier.
2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: “I didn’t go into the Navy for a lifetime, I went in for six months,” Alene B. Duerk told an interviewer in 2016, when she was 96. “But I had an amazing career.”
2018-07-26.headline_main: Alene Duerk, Navy’s First Female Rear Admiral, Is Dead at 98

I would like to form a committee to guard our image.

His mother visited him twice, paying bribes to do so, but then the permissions stopped. She heard nothing of her son’s fate ever since.
2018-07-26.headline_main: Hundreds Died in Syrian Custody, Government Acknowledges

2018-07-26.abstract: Enrichetta Ravina, a former Columbia Business School assistant professor, said she had been harassed and retaliated against, and a jury found in her favor.
2018-07-26.snippet: Enrichetta Ravina, a former Columbia Business School assistant professor, said she had been harassed and retaliated against, and a jury found in her favor.

2018-07-26.abstract: Few women are lionized with public monuments in New York, and as the city prepares to redress that, we asked readers who should be memorialized. Here is what they told us.
2018-07-26.snippet: Few women are lionized with public monuments in New York, and as the city prepares to redress that, we asked readers who should be memorialized. Here is what they told us.
2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: In an effort to correct the civic record left in public art, New York City officials announced in June that we would soon be seeing more statues of women on our streets and in our parks. Right now there are very few — a bronze of Gertrude Stein in Bryant Park, a sculpture of Eleanor Roosevelt in Riverside Park. About a mile north of her you can find Joan of Arc riding a horse, but really, what is Joan of Arc — who fought for many things, not one of them rent control — doing on the Upper West Side of Manhattan?
2018-07-26.headline_main: More Women Deserve Statues in New York. Here Are 10.

2018-07-26.abstract: America is at its best when it turns the disenfranchised into the enfranchised.
2018-07-26.snippet: America is at its best when it turns the disenfranchised into the enfranchised.
2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: Amid the political turmoil of the past few years, there have been faint rustlings of a democratic revival. States have begun to take steps to empower citizens by making voting easier and more inclusive. Since 2015, 12 states have adopted automatic voter registration; voters in Florida will decide in November on a ballot initiative to restore voting rights to felons; in New York and Virginia, Democratic governors have done so (in the case of New York extending these rights to parolees); and the District of Columbia may lower its voting age to 16.
2018-07-26.headline_main: What’s Good for Democracy Is Also Good for Democrats

2018-07-26.abstract: A Baltimore-based community program provides the architecture for kids’ success.
2018-07-26.snippet: A Baltimore-based community program provides the architecture for kids’ success.
2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: Sarah Hemminger grew up in Indiana understanding the debilitating power of social isolation. When she was a girl, her father discovered that their pastor was dipping into church funds and reported it to the congregation. Instead of doing something about the pastor, the community shunned her family. Sarah and her siblings would sit at parties and neighborhood events and nobody would talk to them. She spent eight years of her childhood ostracized.
2018-07-26.headline_main: Where American Renewal Begins

2018-07-26.abstract: Proposals by the Trump administration and various lawmakers threaten the effectiveness of the 45-year-old law that has brought back a host of plants and animals from the edge of extinction.
2018-07-26.snippet: Proposals by the Trump administration and various lawmakers threaten the effectiveness of the 45-year-old law that has brought back a host of plants and animals from the edge of extinction.
2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: We live in the age of extinction, a quiet catastrophe that surely ranks as one of the great ecological and moral crises of our time. The best tool for saving America’s imperiled animals and plants is the Endangered Species Act, first passed by Congress in 1973. But you wouldn’t know it from what’s been happening recently in the nation’s capital.
2018-07-26.headline_main: Vulnerable Species in the Cross Hairs

2018-07-26.abstract: The clothes the first daughter made reflected the same aspirational branding that brought her father to power.
2018-07-26.snippet: The clothes the first daughter made reflected the same aspirational branding that brought her father to power.
2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: Over 100 years ago, Coco Chanel transformed herself from peasant orphan into the founder of a fashion empire. She was the avatar of a new century — unmarried and independent, a woman who took lovers and took off her corset. Chanel’s alluring life became her most bankable commodity. Women clamored for Chanel products (or inexpensive imitations of them) not just for their sleek looks, but because those products seemed to grant entry into the designer’s enviable world. By turning her initials into a logo — those famous interlocking C’s — Chanel crystallized her marketable identity into a recognizable badge of prestige.
2018-07-26.headline_main: Brand Ivanka: Clothing Fit for Trumpian Times

2018-07-26.abstract: Gov. Andrew Cuomo’s role in legalizing same-sex marriage helped him win the L.G.B.T. club’s endorsement over Cynthia Nixon, who would be New York’s first openly gay governor.
2018-07-26.snippet: Gov. Andrew Cuomo’s role in legalizing same-sex marriage helped him win the L.G.B.T. club’s endorsement over Cynthia Nixon, who would be New York’s first openly gay governor.
2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: On Wednesday afternoon, Cynthia Nixon’s campaign sent an email blast to supporters, mocking Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s application for the Stonewall Democratic Club’s endorsement, accusing him of lying in a desperate bid to shore up support.
2018-07-26.headline_main: Stonewall Democrats Club Chooses Cuomo Over Nixon

2018-07-26.abstract: Second-quarter economic growth could register above 4 percent. But the figure may have been driven by one-time factors that will be offset later.
2018-07-26.snippet: Second-quarter economic growth could register above 4 percent. But the figure may have been driven by one-time factors that will be offset later.

2018-07-26.abstract: Betsy DeVos, the education secretary, in the latest move to boost for-profit colleges, plans to eliminate rules that forced them to show that their graduates were getting work.
2018-07-26.snippet: Betsy DeVos, the education secretary, in the latest move to boost for-profit colleges, plans to eliminate rules that forced them to show that their graduates were getting work.
2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Education Secretary Betsy DeVos plans to eliminate regulations that forced for-profit colleges to prove that they provide gainful employment to the students they enroll, in what would be the most drastic in a series of moves that she has made to free the for-profit sector from safeguards put in effect during the Obama era.
2018-07-26.headline_main: DeVos to Eliminate Rules Aimed at Abuses by For-Profit Colleges

2018-07-26.abstract: We revisit “The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill” about 20 years after the album dropped, dive into Ms. Hill’s meteoric rise and ask what she means when she says it “all falls down.”
2018-07-26.snippet: We revisit “The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill” about 20 years after the album dropped, dive into Ms. Hill’s meteoric rise and ask what she means when she says it “all falls down.”
2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: It’s the 20th anniversary of the release of Ms. Lauryn Hill’s 5-time Grammy-winning debut solo album, “The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill.” Still very much a part of our contemporary musical landscape — being sampled by everyone from Drake to Cardi B to Kanye — her prophecies on fame, artistry and the music industry reflect her own career trajectory and serve as a cautionary tale for other artists on the rise. We take a closer look at “Miseducation,” alongside her follow-up “MTV Unplugged No. 2.0” album, and try to understand both her meteoric rise, and what she means when she says it “all falls down.”
2018-07-26.headline_main: We Heard Lauryn Hill, But Did We Listen?

2018-07-26.abstract: The proposal has gained steam among some Democrats, but one health official said that such a plan would “run the risk of depriving seniors of the coverage” they have.
2018-07-26.snippet: The proposal has gained steam among some Democrats, but one health official said that such a plan would “run the risk of depriving seniors of the coverage” they have.

New prisoners include a Lebanese tourist who complained about Egypt on Facebook; a democracy activist who spoke out about sexual harassment; and a visiting grad student from an American university who was arrested as he researched the judiciary.
2018-07-26.headline_main: Despite Egypt’s Dismal Human Rights Record, U.S. Restores Military Aid

2018-07-26.abstract: A New York Post cover story advances the harmful notion that if someone can walk, they must not have a disability.
2018-07-26.snippet: A New York Post cover story advances the harmful notion that if someone can walk, they must not have a disability.
2018-07-26.lead_paragraph: It is one of the distinct pleasures of urban life to be able to wake up on an otherwise fine summer morning, make yourself a cup of coffee, then choke on it at the sight of the front page of your local tabloid. But the cover of The New York Post on Thursday — the 28th anniversary of the Americans With Disabilities Act — was more shocking than usual. It promoted a damaging misperception about people with disabilities, on a day better suited to celebrating their progress in one of the most neglected areas of American civil rights.
2018-07-26.headline_main: A Front-Page Insult to People With Disabilities

2018-07-27.abstract: “The Lehman Trilogy,” a story of American capitalism, is playing on a London stage. Two journalists — one British, one American — discuss.
2018-07-27.snippet: “The Lehman Trilogy,” a story of American capitalism, is playing on a London stage. Two journalists — one British, one American — discuss.
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: LONDON — It was one of the most dramatic days in Wall Street history, Andrew Ross Sorkin wrote in The New York Times in September 2008, as the bank Lehman Brothers teetered on the brink of collapse. The day had been alarming, distressing, disquieting — but was it really the stuff of drama? The Italian playwright Stefano Massini’s “The Lehman Trilogy” takes the events of the crisis as its starting point, before delving back into the history of the family who founded the bank. First performed in Paris in 2013, the play is now running at the National Theater in London through Oct. 20. Here, Holly Williams, a British critic and journalist who writes about the theater, and David Segal, an American columnist and business reporter for The Times, discuss putting the world of finance on the stage.
2018-07-27.headline_main: A Dramatic Play About Finance? Yes, if It’s Lehman Brothers

2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: I’m a sucker for dramatic homecomings. I love stories of reunited siblings and I devour videos of dogs greeting returning soldiers, but I participate in my own reunion spectacle every weekday. When I pick up my 3-year-old from preschool, she charges at me like I’m an unattended bowl of Cheddar Goldfish. It’s the best feeling to witness her happiness upon seeing me. From across the room, she olympically hurdles, jumps and pole vaults into the pillow of my outstretched arms.
2018-07-27.headline_main: When Being a Good ‘Dad’ Gets You Promoted to ‘Mommy’

2018-07-27.abstract: Ben Passmore’s “Your Black Friend and Other Strangers” is one of three books reviewed that struggle with difference, dysphoria and the struggle to survive.
2018-07-27.snippet: Ben Passmore’s “Your Black Friend and Other Strangers” is one of three books reviewed that struggle with difference, dysphoria and the struggle to survive.
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: “Your Black Friend,” one of the buzziest comics in recent years, is by a young artist who cut his teeth in the anarchist-punk scene of New Orleans. Reading and discussing Frantz Fanon’s “Black Skin, White Masks” with a friend in 2016, Ben Passmore realized, as he told an interviewer, the extent to which “we, black punks, live in a different world than our white friends.” With a comics festival on the horizon, Passmore, inspired, quickly drew and photocopied his missive of alienation to debut there. The 11-page story was soon reissued as a full-color pamphlet by Silver Sprocket (a tiny San Francisco-based comics publisher that is also a bicycle club and an activist collective) and it snapped up numerous industry awards. Now Passmore is out with YOUR BLACK FRIEND AND OTHER STRANGERS (Silver Sprocket, $20), a beautifully printed collection tackling dysphoria and difference.
2018-07-27.headline_main: Cartoonists Who Draw in Order to Be Heard

2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: Natasha Cornstein, the chief executive of Blushington, a chain of beauty lounges specializing in makeup application, has opened five of the company’s seven locations nationwide. Watching it — agog that it ever got made in the first place — felt like getting a little glimpse into the future, and not just because its dystopian satire is half a step away from our reality.

2018-07-27.abstract: How the Obama administration watched the demise of Arab democracy — and paved the way for Trump’s embrace of dictators.
2018-07-27.snippet: How the Obama administration watched the demise of Arab democracy — and paved the way for Trump’s embrace of dictators.
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: President Trump boasts that he has reversed American policies across the Middle East. Where his predecessor hoped to win hearts and minds, Mr. Trump champions the axiom that brute force is the only response to extremism — whether in Iran, Syria, Yemen or the Palestinian territories. 2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: The summer movie season has come to be ruled by big-budget fantasies: superheroes, star-driven action pieces, animated entertainment for families. Yet this summer has seen a remarkable crop of quieter, more contemplative movies — biographical documentaries about luminaries past and present, among them “RBG,” a profile of the Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsberg; “Won’t You Be My Neighbor?” about the life and work of Fred Rogers; “Whitney,” a family-authorized look at the rise and fall of Whitney Houston; and “McQueen,” about the fashion designer Alexander McQueen.

2018-07-27.headline_main: ‘Blood Moon’ Provides Dramatic Sights, and a Dose of Folklore

2018-07-27.abstract: The performance of social media companies depends on avoiding scandals and protecting users. Will investors come to see that?
2018-07-27.snippet: The performance of social media companies depends on avoiding scandals and protecting users. Will investors come to see that?

2018-07-27.headline_main: The Cost of Policing Facebook and Twitter Is Spooking Wall St. It Shouldn’t.

2018-07-27.abstract: Elin Ersson’s live-streamed protest against the deportation of an Afghan asylum seeker focused attention on the forced return of asylum seekers.
2018-07-27.snippet: Elin Ersson’s live-streamed protest against the deportation of an Afghan asylum seeker focused attention on the forced return of asylum seekers.
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: OSTERSUND, Sweden — When she boarded the plane, Elin Ersson had no intention of flying. Her goal was to ensure another passenger disembarked to avoid what she feared would be his certain death.
2018-07-27.headline_main: Act of Defiance Casts Harsh Light on Europe’s Deportations of Asylum Seekers

2018-07-27.abstract: The state accused the company of failing to expand broadband service to rural areas, and ordered it to devise a plan to exit New York within 60 days.
2018-07-27.snippet: The state accused the company of failing to expand broadband service to rural areas, and ordered it to devise a plan to exit New York within 60 days.

2018-07-27.abstract: Three years ago, the ride-hailing company easily fought off city regulation. But the landscape has shifted, and a cap proposed by the City Council stands a better chance.
2018-07-27.snippet: Three years ago, the ride-hailing company easily fought off city regulation. But the landscape has shifted, and a cap proposed by the City Council stands a better chance.
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: The last time New York City tried to impose a cap on Uber’s vehicles, the rout was brutal. Uber introduced a “de Blasio view” in its ride-hailing app, blaming long wait times on Mayor Bill de Blasio. Celebrities like Ashton Kutcher and Kate Upton voiced their support for Uber on Twitter.
2018-07-27.headline_main: This Time It’s Uber on the Defensive in Battle With New York

2018-07-27.abstract: 1,387 facilities got only one out of five stars for staffing because they failed to maintain the required nursing coverage or to provide data proving they did.
2018-07-27.snippet: 1,387 facilities got only one out of five stars for staffing because they failed to maintain the required nursing coverage or to provide data proving they did.
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: Medicare has lowered its star ratings for staffing levels in one out of 11 of the nation’s nursing homes — almost 1,400 of them — because they were either inadequately staffed with registered nurses or failed to provide payroll data that proved they had the required nursing coverage, federal records released this week show.
2018-07-27.headline_main: Medicare Slashes Star Ratings for Staffing at 1 in 11 Nursing Homes

2018-07-27.abstract: Mr. Watt, whose term expires in January, is in charge of overseeing mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac. He said he did not break any laws.

2018-07-27.headline_main: Housing Finance Director, Mel Watt, Investigated for Sexual Harassment

2018-07-27.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, July 28, 2018.
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: “Shops are out of fans, ice, sun cream, ice cream, and there’s a water shortage that has left our beautiful, lush parks all parched and yellow. We’re not equipped for this, so it feels kind of apocalyptic.”

2018-07-27.abstract: Footage recorded for “The Force Awakens” will allow her to appear as Leia Organa in “Star Wars: Episode IX.”

2018-07-27.abstract: Toronto leaders react with anger and shock, calling the move to reduce the size of the City Council a blow to democracy. Campaigning was already underway to fill the council seats.

2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — The new premier of Ontario, Doug Ford, announced on Friday that he intended to reduce the size of Toronto’s elected government by nearly half, less than three months before the municipal election.

2018-07-27.abstract: I shut down the sprinkler system and tested a new aesthetic. To my delight, I discovered that it’s beautiful.

2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif.

2018-07-27.abstract: Growing up in a friendly Dallas suburb, I never imagined the hostility lurking beneath the surface.
2018-07-27.snippet: Growing up in a friendly Dallas suburb, I never imagined the hostility lurking beneath the surface.
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: The day my parents took their oath of citizenship, I skipped school, put on a hideous lavender chiffon dress that I believed was the height of sophistication for a 12-year-old and got into the family Corolla to ride to the ceremony.
2018-07-27.headline_main: What Happened to the Country That Made Us Citizens?

2018-07-27.abstract: Government officials and business leaders say that homogeneity is limiting options in a state with an aging work force and stagnant population growth.
2018-07-27.snippet: Government officials and business leaders say that homogeneity is limiting options in a state with an aging work force and stagnant population growth.
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, N.H. — Catalina Celentano used to hold training sessions for hospital workers in Lynn, Mass., to familiarize them with the cultures of patients from Cambodia, Russia and the Dominican Republic. When she moved to New Hampshire, she suddenly found herself in an ethnic vacuum.
2018-07-27.headline_main: New Hampshire, 94 Percent White, Asks: How Do You Diversify a Whole State?

2018-07-27.abstract: Local officials seem resigned to the fact that they will receive little or no help from the Trump administration, whose main policy response has been a plan to increase some rents.
2018-07-27.snippet: Local officials seem resigned to the fact that they will receive little or no help from the Trump administration, whose main policy response has been a plan to increase some rents.
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The country is in the grips of an escalating housing affordability crisis. Millions of low-income Americans are paying 70 percent or more of their incomes for shelter, while rents continue to rise and construction of affordable rental apartments lags far behind the need.
2018-07-27.headline_main: As Affordable Housing Crisis Grows, HUD Sits on the Sidelines

2018-07-27.abstract: Mike Cagney lost his job as chief executive of Social Finance after a board investigation into sexual misconduct. Some of those board members have since funded his next venture.
2018-07-27.snippet: Mike Cagney lost his job as chief executive of Social Finance after a board investigation into sexual misconduct. Some of those board members have since funded his next venture.
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Last September, the board of the online lending company Social Finance  ousted its chief executive, Mike Cagney, after questions about sexual misconduct.
2018-07-27.headline_main: Sex Scandal Toppled a Silicon Valley Chief. Investors Say, So What?

2018-07-27.abstract: Could I have survived what the men of the Indianapolis experienced?
2018-07-27.snippet: Could I have survived what the men of the Indianapolis experienced?
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: TRAVERSE CITY, Mich. — Each summer, as Lake Michigan finally begins to warm, I think of the men of the World War II cruiser Indianapolis and the worst disaster at sea in United States naval history. I go down to the lake and I wonder: How would I have survived what they experienced?
2018-07-27.headline_main: Moral Lessons From the Crucible of the Sea

2018-07-27.abstract: Yankees Manager Aaron Boone could not completely shrug off Aaron Judge’s injury, but he did his best to play down the impact it would have on his team.
2018-07-27.snippet: Yankees Manager Aaron Boone could not completely shrug off Aaron Judge’s injury, but he did his best to play down the impact it would have on his team.
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: Aaron Judge, the most dangerous hitter in the Yankees’ lineup, will be out of action for at least the next three weeks with a chip fracture in his right wrist. His absence robs the Yankees of their leader in home runs, on-base percentage and on-base plus slugging percentage, and their co-leader in runs batted in. And it leaves a gaping hole in the batting order, where Judge hit second for 97 of his team’s 101 games.
2018-07-27.headline_main: Boone Is Confident the Yankees Can Weather Aaron Judge’s Absence

2018-07-27.abstract: Imran Khan, cricket-star-turned-politician, promises a new path for Pakistan. But his ties to the military, and his own at-times erratic behavior, may stand in the way.
2018-07-27.snippet: Imran Khan, cricket-star-turned-politician, promises a new path for Pakistan. But his ties to the military, and his own at-times erratic behavior, may stand in the way.
2018-07-27.lead_paragraph: Imran Khan, the cricketer who led Pakistan to a glorious World Cup victory over its former colonial ruler, England, a quarter century ago, led his political party to an equally impressive victory in Pakistan’s national elections this week. In a country as corrupt and troubled as Pakistan, a new, charismatic leader is bound to raise hopes; whether Mr. Khan can deliver is a far different question.
2018-07-27.headline_main: A New Batsman for Pakistan

2018-07-27.abstract: Donald Trump Jr. and Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel, were spotted only feet apart at Reagan National Airport near Washington.

2018-07-28.abstract: Don’t argue with 4.1 percent growth.

2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: Remember Jack Kemp? In the fall of 1996, Bob Dole’s vice-presidential candidate complained in his debate with Al Gore that economic growth of 2.5 percent just wasn’t good enough. The American people thought better of it, and Dole-Kemp went on to lose the race by more than eight million votes.

I’m told this class was about 15 people strong;  add the wits of the veteran constructors Andy Kravis and Mr. Last and you get a very busy hive of very brainy bees putting together this grid.

2018-07-28.abstract: Though Japan brought the world the concept of “death from overwork,” South Koreans actually work longer hours. The government is trying to change that.
2018-07-28.snippet: Though Japan brought the world the concept of “death from overwork,” South Koreans actually work longer hours. The government is trying to change that.
2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — Lee Han-bit helped produce a television series called “Drinking Solo,” in which young adults cramming for a high-stakes civil service exam often drink to relieve anxiety. But working weeks without a break and asking his own employees to work 20-hour days, Mr. Lee was consumed by pressures of his own.

2018-07-28.abstract: In a report to be released Sunday, a parliamentary committee accused Facebook of providing “disingenuous” answers to questions and of withholding information.
2018-07-28.snippet: In a report to be released Sunday, a parliamentary committee accused Facebook of providing “disingenuous” answers to questions and of withholding information.

2018-07-28.abstract: The big business of being Gwyneth Paltrow. Larry David. Billy Joel. Israel picks identity over democracy. And more.
2018-07-28.snippet: The big business of being Gwyneth Paltrow. Larry David. Billy Joel. Israel picks identity over democracy. And more.
2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: Welcome to the weekend. Are you planning a lazy one? Maybe you’ll finally finish that book or get the linen closet organized. Perhaps you’re on vacation by a lake or planning a picnic in the park. Wherever you’re going, be sure to take a few minutes to read some great journalism (I mean the Gwyneth Paltrow story alone!).
2018-07-28.headline_main: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads

2018-07-28.abstract: Democrats and Republicans alike believe that when Georgia chooses between Stacey Abrams and Brian Kemp, they will be signaling what the Deep South powerhouse stands for.
2018-07-28.snippet: Democrats and Republicans alike believe that when Georgia chooses between Stacey Abrams and Brian Kemp, they will be signaling what the Deep South powerhouse stands for.
2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — The Republican won the nomination Tuesday after branding himself a politically incorrect conservative who would “round up criminal illegals” and haul them to the border in his very own pickup. The Democrat all but opened her campaign by demanding that the iconic carvings of Jefferson Davis, Robert E. Lee and Stonewall Jackson be sandblasted off Stone Mountain.
2018-07-28.headline_main: In Georgia Governor’s Race, a Defining Moment for a Southern State

2018-07-28.abstract: The award-nominated Anchorage has a firm focus on vegetables — though fish and pork do make appearances.

2018-07-28.abstract: Our correspondent went to the deserts of Patagonia to examine how China secured its new base, a symbol of its growing clout in the region.
2018-07-28.snippet: Our correspondent went to the deserts of Patagonia to examine how China secured its new base, a symbol of its growing clout in the region.

2018-07-28.headline_main: From a Space Station in Argentina, China Expands Its Reach in Latin America

2018-07-28.abstract: Beautycon is the Super Bowl of the beauty industry, where new products are unveiled and celebrities show up to launch their forays into the lucrative makeup business.
2018-07-28.snippet: Beautycon is the Super Bowl of the beauty industry, where new products are unveiled and celebrities show up to launch their forays into the lucrative makeup business.
2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Thousands of cat-eyed, contoured-cheeked, glitter-doused women — and more than a few painted men — descended on the 347,000-square-foot South Hall of the Los Angeles Convention Center earlier this month, gathering at the makeup mecca that is Beautycon. For two days, as they wandered among more than 200 elaborately festooned booths sponsored by brands like Maybelline and Lime Crime, they searched for samples and stars. Some would be instantly familiar to anyone with a passing knowledge of reality TV (i.e., Kim Kardashian West). Others clearly had a more specialized fan base. (Nikita Dragun, anyone? How about Gigi Gorgeous or Manny MUA?)
2018-07-28.headline_main: Beauty Is in the Eye of These Beholders

2018-07-28.abstract: The idea was to increase the economy’s capacity. There’s no sign that’s happening.
2018-07-28.snippet: The idea was to increase the economy’s capacity. There’s no sign that’s happening.
2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: For the most part, reporting on 2nd quarter growth has been pretty decent. But I haven’t seen clear explanations of why one quarter’s growth tells us so little about longer-term growth prospects. I’m sure that reporters get it; maybe they assume that readers already know (a very bad assumption), or maybe they’re afraid of sounding too technical. But anyway, it seems as if there’s a gap worth filling; so here it comes.
2018-07-28.headline_main: Why One Quarter’s Growth Tells Us Nothing

2018-07-28.abstract: Security forces battled insurgents at a midwifery school in Jalalabad, and two attackers died. Three female students were wounded.
2018-07-28.snippet: Security forces battled insurgents at a midwifery school in Jalalabad, and two attackers died. Three female students were wounded.
2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: JALALABAD, Afghanistan — A nearly seven-hour assault by extremists on a school for midwives in eastern Afghanistan killed two people and wounded 11 others, but at the end of a harrowing day, the authorities managed to avert a far greater tragedy.
2018-07-28.headline_main: Extremists Kill 2 at Afghan School for Midwives, but Students Escape

2018-07-28.abstract: Sooner or later, everyone has to face the consequences of their bad choices.
2018-07-28.snippet: Sooner or later, everyone has to face the consequences of their bad choices.
2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: Dear Sugars returns to Portland, Ore., for another epic live show. Special guests Mitchell S. Jackson and Rebecca Skloot share the stage with the Sugars to tell stories of personal reckoning and answer letters from the audience. To some extent, every letter the Sugars receive is a kind of reckoning, as it’s often the letter writer’s first attempt at taking account of their mistakes and delusions. In this episode, the Sugars take a long hard look at transgressions of love, friendship, the self and so much more.
2018-07-28.headline_main: Dear Sugars Live: The Great Reckoning

2018-07-28.abstract: Exotic travels and sunny beaches are so last year. Well-off overachievers are devoting their summer to pursuits like boat building and book writing.
2018-07-28.snippet: Exotic travels and sunny beaches are so last year. Well-off overachievers are devoting their summer to pursuits like boat building and book writing.
2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: Trent Preszler, the chief executive of Bedell Cellars winery on the North Fork of Long Island, won’t spend his summer spotting penguins in the Galápagos or trekking through the Atacama Desert in Chile, as he has in years past. Instead, he is meticulously hand-crafting an 18-foot-long wooden canoe inspired by 19th-century Maine fur trappers.
2018-07-28.headline_main: Summer Vacation? Nah, I’m Taking a Creative Hiatus

2018-07-28.abstract: There’s no way to make this pretty.
2018-07-28.snippet: There’s no way to make this pretty.
2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: I was seeing a guy from London, and he told me Scott and Zelda Fitzgerald were his favorite couple. He was charming, exciting and “got” me. His choice sounded so romantic, so like him.
2018-07-28.headline_main: Please Stop Merchandising Mental Illness

2018-07-28.abstract: A 157-acre hilltop plot in Los Angeles is being pitched as the city’s most expensive residential property ever.
2018-07-28.snippet: A 157-acre hilltop plot in Los Angeles is being pitched as the city’s most expensive residential property ever.
2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — A property about to go on the market here consists of 157 acres of hilltop land in the coveted Beverly Hills 90210 ZIP code, a 10-minute drive from Rodeo Drive. With its 360-degree views, you can spot many of Los Angeles’s major landmarks in the distance, from Century City to downtown, and even — on a clear day — the Pacific Ocean. There are winding, private roads that lead to big, flat lawns the size of football fields.
2018-07-28.headline_main: Would You Pay $1 Billion for This View?

2018-07-28.abstract: Pope Francis accepted his letter of resignation and ordered the former archbishop of Washington to remain in seclusion while accusations against him were being examined, the Vatican said.
2018-07-28.snippet: Pope Francis accepted his letter of resignation and ordered the former archbishop of Washington to remain in seclusion while accusations against him were being examined, the Vatican said.
2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: ROME — Pope Francis has accepted the resignation of Cardinal Theodore E. McCarrick, the former archbishop of Washington, from the College of Cardinals, ordering him to a “life of prayer and penance” after allegations that the cardinal sexually abused minors and adult seminarians over the course of decades, the Vatican announced on Saturday.
2018-07-28.headline_main: Cardinal Theodore McCarrick Resigns Amid Sexual Abuse Scandal

2018-07-28.abstract: Ariana Cannavo and John Murphy had a secret crush on each other, but she wouldn’t date him until her crew coaches, a.k.a. his parents, urged them to.

2018-07-28.headline_main: Now Running for Office, Adam Greenberg. You May Remember His First At-Bat.

2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: Q: I live in a house in Rockville Centre, N.Y., with a river view but no direct access to the water. My neighbor’s hedges and overgrown shrubbery are obscuring my panoramic view of this waterway and its waterfowl. Do I have the right to ask the neighbors to trim back these obstructions, and to what extent?
2018-07-28.headline_main: My Neighbors Stole My River View. Can I Make Them Give It Back?

2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: The suffragist heroes Elizabeth Cady Stanton and Susan B. Anthony seized control of the feminist narrative of the 19th century. Their influential history of the movement still governs popular understanding of the struggle for women’s rights and will no doubt serve as a touchstone for commemorations that will unfold across the United States around the centennial of the 19th Amendment in 2020.

As he surveyed his troops’ battle line, he said: “They couldn’t shoot an elephant at this distance.” Moments later, he was killed with a shot to the cheek by a Confederate sharpshooter.

2018-07-28.abstract: Patients say they prefer a quick and painless demise. But they often choose otherwise.
2018-07-28.snippet: Patients say they prefer a quick and painless demise. But they often choose otherwise.
2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: Like most patients, mine wanted to live as long as possible. So when I brought up the option of a small implantable defibrillator for his failing heart, he immediately said yes. The device would be inserted in his chest to monitor his heartbeat and apply an electrical shock if the rhythm turned into something dangerous. It was like the paddles in the emergency room, I told him, but it would always be inside him.
2018-07-28.headline_main: How Do You Want to Die?

2018-07-28.abstract: At the end of my marriage, I found the grief and hope I felt expressed everywhere in nature.

2018-07-28.lead_paragraph: On the morning I left my husband and moved out of our apartment, I saw a giant birds’ nest tear apart, fall from the tree branch and crash down onto the pavement. The nest belonged to the green monk parakeets that lived down the street in a honey locust tree, where they spent their days chattering, grooming one another and weaving twigs, string and plastic bags into a basketlike housing complex as long and wide as a bicycle. On this day, the nest suddenly ruptured; half of it plummeted into the street. I came running.
2018-07-28.headline_main: The Earth in Sadness

2018-07-29.abstract: Samin Nosrat wrote about chapli burgers in this week’s Eat column. Let them kick off days of good eating.
2018-07-29.snippet: Samin Nosrat wrote about chapli burgers in this week’s Eat column. Let them kick off days of good eating.
2018-07-29.lead_paragraph: Good morning. Our Samin Nosrat wrote about American burgers and Iranian kebabs in her Eat column for The Times this week, and about how they remained distinct aspects of her identity until she ate a chapli kebab on the side of a dusty road in northwestern Pakistan: two patties of seasoned ground beef lightly fried in oil, then placed on hot naan and drizzled with green yogurt chutney. “Spicy, and creamy, crunchy and chewy — the mix of textures and flavors was irresistible,” she wrote. “It was a burger but better.”
2018-07-29.headline_main: What to Cook This Week

2018-07-29.abstract: To write “Northland,” Porter Fox spent three years traveling about 4,000 miles from Maine to Washington, meeting people, studying history and observing nature.
2018-07-29.snippet: To write “Northland,” Porter Fox spent three years traveling about 4,000 miles from Maine to Washington, meeting people, studying history and observing nature.
2018-07-29.lead_paragraph: There’s no shortage of reporting and opinion about the border between Mexico and the United States. Much less often in the spotlight, the border between the United States and Canada nonetheless offers Americans an instructive window onto their past, present and future. It’s the longest international boundary in the world, and was the setting for a great deal of momentous early American history. To write his new book, “Northland,” Porter Fox spent three years traveling about 4,000 miles from Maine to Washington, meeting the region’s people, studying its history and learning its natural contours up close. “I didn’t make an itinerary,” Mr. Fox writes. “There was no timeline. I started the way every other northland explorer had for the last 400 years: I packed a canoe, tent, maps and books, and headed for the line.” Below, he talks about what he learned on his travels, his obsession with certain historical characters and more.
2018-07-29.headline_main: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: The American Border (Not That One)

2018-07-29.abstract: The music mogul is an executive producer of a sprawling six-part docu-series centered on the death of Mr. Martin, and the divisive verdict.
2018-07-29.snippet: The music mogul is an executive producer of a sprawling six-part docu-series centered on the death of Mr. Martin, and the divisive verdict.
2018-07-29.lead_paragraph: In the six-part docu-series “Rest in Power: The Trayvon Martin Story,” the filmmakers Jenner Furst and Julia Willoughby Nason recount the teenager’s life and his deadly encounter with George Zimmerman in a gated townhouse community outside Orlando. Through interviews with key players, including Mr. Martin’s family and Don West, a defense lawyer for Mr. Zimmerman, the directors zero in on what they see as a flawed criminal justice system. They also make an argument that the divisive case (in which Mr. Zimmerman was acquitted of second-degree murder and manslaughter) galvanized both the Black Lives Matter movement and white nationalists.
2018-07-29.headline_main: Jay-Z on ‘Rest in Power: The Trayvon Martin Story’ and Activism

2018-07-30.abstract: Dogs are order. Cats are chaos. Dogs are loyal and compliant. Cats are … not. Why has the internet suddenly switched its allegiance? Episode 1 of our video series.
2018-07-30.snippet: Dogs are order. Cats are chaos. Dogs are loyal and compliant. Cats are … not. Why has the internet suddenly switched its allegiance? Episode 1 of our video series.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: I am a friend to all internet animals. The excitable turtle who head-butts the aquarium glass. The horny sloth who embarks on a slow aquatic journey in search of a mate. The elusive Utah “goat-man” who dresses as a goat and lives among a wild herd. All are welcome on my feeds.
2018-07-30.headline_main: Dogs Took Over the Internet. Our Souls Are at Stake.

2018-07-30.abstract: From digital helpmates like Siri to computer-generated Instagram models like Lil Miquela, feminized tech is all around us. Are actual human women starting to look a little bit unreal? Episode 2 of our video series.
2018-07-30.snippet: From digital helpmates like Siri to computer-generated Instagram models like Lil Miquela, feminized tech is all around us. Are actual human women starting to look a little bit unreal? Episode 2 of our video series.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: Congratulations to Kylie Jenner on being named an almost billionaire. Kylie earned the valuation thanks to the profits and potential of her Kylie Cosmetics makeup line, but she really made her money by expertly mapping her face and body to the demands of the Instagram platform, attracting its users to her feed, and then finding something to sell them. Her very flesh has been manipulated for peak marketability: When she was still a teenager, she inflated her lips with injectable fillers and then leveraged the spectacle to sell lip-related products to fellow teens. She gives whole new meaning to the term “self-made.”
2018-07-30.headline_main: Welcome Our New Fembot Overlords

2018-07-30.abstract: It’s often too complicated. And even when it isn’t, almost no one does it.
2018-07-30.snippet: It’s often too complicated. And even when it isn’t, almost no one does it.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: Each year, for well over a decade, more people have faced higher health insurance deductibles. The theory goes like this: The more of your own money that you have to spend on health care, the more careful you will be — buying only necessary care, purging waste from the system.
2018-07-30.headline_main: Shopping for Health Care Doesn’t Work. So What Might?

2018-07-30.abstract: What doctors and parents should discuss about medicating a child for A.D.H.D., anxiety or depression.
2018-07-30.snippet: What doctors and parents should discuss about medicating a child for A.D.H.D., anxiety or depression.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: Whenever I write about children getting medications for anxiety, for depression, or especially for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, a certain number of readers respond with anger and suspicion, accusing me of being part of a conspiracy to medicate children for behaviors that are either part of the normal range of childhood or else the direct result of bad schools, bad environments or bad parenting.
2018-07-30.headline_main: When Medicines Affect a Child’s Mind and Behavior

2018-07-30.abstract: In the age of the selfie, we spend a lot of time showing off our faces. But lately a different body part is vying for attention. (Well: two.) What are our hands trying to tell us? Episode 3 of our video series.
2018-07-30.snippet: In the age of the selfie, we spend a lot of time showing off our faces. But lately a different body part is vying for attention. (Well: two.) What are our hands trying to tell us? Episode 3 of our video series.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: We’re living in what the French philosopher Michel Serres calls the “Thumbelina Generation”: Instead of talking with our mouths, we’re creating vast visual and textual worlds with finger taps and swipes. And hands aren’t just the drivers of online communication. Now they’re the stars of it, too. Facebook is crawling with “hands-only” videos in which pairs of gorgeous paws wield glue guns and mix slime and cook mini churros or whatever.
2018-07-30.headline_main: The Hidden Language of Hands Videos

2018-07-30.snippet: Donald Hall died last month at 89, and his recently published memoir, “A Carnival of Losses: Notes Nearing Ninety,” is “up there with the best things he did.”
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: Donald Hall, who died on June 23 at 89, was not a particularly nimble poet. His verse had a homely, bucolic, beans-on-the-woodstove quality. He was more cabbage than tulip. To borrow an analogy from baseball, a sport he loved, he was the sort of batter who got on base thanks to walks, bunts, bloopers into right field and a good deal of hustle. He was a plugger.

2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: As I watched the televised 2016 presidential debates, listening to the then-candidate Donald Trump arguing various points with Hillary Clinton, a chill went down my spine. I was in the middle of writing a new play, a comic parody of white supremacist fiction. With his hyperbolic attacks on immigrants and minorities — African-Americans “living in hell,” Latino “gangs roaming the street” and insinuations that a long list of Jewish philanthropists and politicians was conspiring against him — Mr. Trump sounded like a character straight out of my research.
2018-07-30.headline_main: Inside the World of Racist Science Fiction

2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: When “The Great British Baking Show” finally made its way to the United States in 2014, it was a jolt — and not just because everyone baked tidy shortbreads. Americans can do that, too. It was because everyone was nice. Jovial. Focused on their own work and not on sabotage or subterfuge. The judges were straightforward and fair. The hosts were funny and supportive. The material was appropriate for all ages. Why couldn’t every show be like this? Why couldn’t any show?
2018-07-30.headline_main: Review: The D.I.Y. Joys of ‘Making It’

2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: A stolen violin valued at more than $200,000 has been returned to its owner after being sold to a Massachusetts pawnshop for $50, according to the police. The violin, which was designed by Ferdinando Gagliano, among the most prolific violin makers working in Naples, Italy, in the late 18th century, was stolen July 20 from the home of a couple who were sleeping.

2018-07-30.abstract: Prosciutto di Carpegna from the Adriatic Coast of Italy is a ham cured with a rub of seasoned lard.
2018-07-30.snippet: Prosciutto di Carpegna from the Adriatic Coast of Italy is a ham cured with a rub of seasoned lard.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: The Italian cured hams generally called prosciutto, can come from many regions, most notably the Emilia-Romagna, the source of the best-known one from the Parma area, with a mild, sweet flavor. Go farther north, and there’s somewhat more intense San Daniele. Toscana from Tuscany is more robust. Now, for the first time, prosciutto di Carpegna, mainly from the Marche region on the Adriatic coast east of Tuscany, is available in the United States. The rosy hams, aged 20 months, are cured with a rub of seasoned lard for a sweet richness, ready for seasonal wedges of melon or fresh figs.
2018-07-30.headline_main: A Richer Prosciutto Arrives in New York

2018-07-30.abstract: The agency told seven companies that sell lasers for cosmetic gynecology and related procedures to stop marketing them for unapproved uses.
2018-07-30.snippet: The agency told seven companies that sell lasers for cosmetic gynecology and related procedures to stop marketing them for unapproved uses.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Food and Drug Administration on Monday announced that it had warned several companies to stop marketing laser devices for procedures billed as “vaginal rejuvenation,” saying they were dangerous and deceptive treatments.
2018-07-30.headline_main: Vaginal ‘Rejuvenation’ Treatments May Be Unsafe, the F.D.A. Says

2018-07-30.abstract: This new vegetable has stems like broccoli and florets that are lacier than cauliflower florets.
2018-07-30.snippet: This new vegetable has stems like broccoli and florets that are lacier than cauliflower florets.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: You can see the cauliflower ancestry in Caulilini Sweet Stem Cauliflower, a new vegetable with a delicate, lacy ivory crown. Caulilini is grown by Mann Packing in Salinas, Calif., and is now in New York stores. Mild in flavor and acceptable raw, caulilini will be tender after a five-minute steam and an ice-water shock. Bathe whole clusters of the flower-topped stems in butter or marinate them in a vinaigrette. Use small clusters of the flower tops to garnish a soup, like a cold cauliflower velouté.
2018-07-30.headline_main: Meet Caulilini, a Lacy New Cauliflower

2018-07-30.abstract: As the British government prepares for the possibility of a disruptive “no deal” Brexit, it has stirred alarm with plans to stockpile essentials.
2018-07-30.snippet: As the British government prepares for the possibility of a disruptive “no deal” Brexit, it has stirred alarm with plans to stockpile essentials.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Trucks parked along freeways or stuck in gridlocked ports. Food disappearing from supermarket shelves and stocks of medicines under strain. The military on standby, ready to step in to avert crisis.
2018-07-30.headline_main: Brexit Plans Raise Fears of Food Shortages and Jammed Ports

2018-07-30.abstract: Moruga scorpion peppers give this vindaloo curry hot sauce its powerful heat.
2018-07-30.snippet: Moruga scorpion peppers give this vindaloo curry hot sauce its powerful heat.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: For American cooks, the simple route to India is curry powder; a spoonful  in chicken salad or lamb stew, and you’re on your way. But you can take it up a notch or two with a splash of a new vindaloo curry sauce, which delivers pungency and serious fire. Vinegar, onions, coconut oil and honey temper the Moruga scorpion peppers in the sauce; those chiles are among the world’s hottest, according to the University of New Mexico, which keeps a record of such matters. A little of this mustard-colored seasoning will go a long way.
2018-07-30.headline_main: A Curry Hot Sauce With Serious Kick

2018-07-30.abstract: The trial of Paul Manafort, President Trump’s former campaign chairman, concerns his work as a consultant in Ukraine. But the Russia inquiry looms over the proceedings.
2018-07-30.snippet: The trial of Paul Manafort, President Trump’s former campaign chairman, concerns his work as a consultant in Ukraine. But the Russia inquiry looms over the proceedings.

2018-07-30.abstract: Rind, a new fruit snack that includes the peel, is a treat suitable for a cheese board or a nibble on the go.
2018-07-30.snippet: Rind, a new fruit snack that includes the peel, is a treat suitable for a cheese board or a nibble on the go.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: They’re not nose-to-tail, but the dried fruits from Rind follow the notion of no waste, as the  oranges, kiwis, apples, peaches and, unusually, persimmons still have their rinds. Only the pineapple is peeled. All make for good snacking, to serve with cheese, or chopped into biscotti or other baked goods.
2018-07-30.headline_main: Dried Fruits With More Texture

2018-07-30.abstract: Roth Monroe is creamy, with fruity notes that would pair nicely with a glass of Sauternes.
2018-07-30.snippet: Roth Monroe is creamy, with fruity notes that would pair nicely with a glass of Sauternes.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: This hefty 20-ounce cheese wheel is labeled Monroe, after the town in Wisconsin where the company that makes it is based. Within the cheese’s ruddy, slightly tacky rind is a pale, satiny interior. What is remarkable is that despite its penetrating barnyard aroma, this double cream, washed-rind wheel from the Roth cheese company tastes fruity and rather mild. Be sure to allow it to come to room temperature before serving; it merits a glass of Sauternes alongside.
2018-07-30.headline_main: A Mild-Mannered, but Sophisticated Midwestern Cheese

2018-07-30.abstract: Officials initially described a hit-and-run in Tajikistan as an “attack,” and hours later, the Islamic State claimed responsibility, saying the assailants were inspired by the group.
2018-07-30.snippet: Officials initially described a hit-and-run in Tajikistan as an “attack,” and hours later, the Islamic State claimed responsibility, saying the assailants were inspired by the group.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — A car ran down a group of touring cyclists in the Central Asian state of Tajikistan over the weekend, killing four people from the United States, the Netherlands and Switzerland. On Monday, the Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack.
2018-07-30.headline_main: ISIS Says It Killed 4 Cyclists in Tajikistan

2018-07-30.abstract: At Ruffian in the East Village, Homer’s classic work provides the inspiration for a special menu through the month of August.
2018-07-30.snippet: At Ruffian in the East Village, Homer’s classic work provides the inspiration for a special menu through the month of August.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: For the month of August, Ruffian — a pencil-thin wine bar with a 19-seat counter and not much else — will take you on a voyage to the ports of call in Homer’s “Odyssey.” “We’ve had great success serving Greek wines, and we thought this would be interesting and fun,” said Moshe Schulman, a partner in the restaurant. Alexis Percival and Patrick Cournot, two other partners, have selected wines from places like Crete, Turkey, the Peloponnesus, Macedonia, Sicily, Sardinia and Majorca to pour by the glass. Joe Kozlinski, the bartender, has created an alluring vermouth-based Homeric cocktail called the Wine-Dark Sea. And somehow, from their shoe-box kitchen, the chefs Andy Alexandre and Josh Ochoa have managed to turn out succulent roasted lamb with a yogurt sauce, pickled tomatoes with coriander and pita dusted with lotus seeds (in homage to the Lotus-eaters) to accompany the wines. Three dishes, which serve two, are $45.
2018-07-30.headline_main: Turn Dinner Into an Odyssey

2018-07-30.abstract: Moe Berg was not much of a hitter, but he was a very good spy. He is the subject of a book, a movie, and soon an exhibit in Cooperstown.
2018-07-30.snippet: Moe Berg was not much of a hitter, but he was a very good spy. He is the subject of a book, a movie, and soon an exhibit in Cooperstown.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y. — You don’t become the subject of an exhibit at the Baseball Hall of Fame by being a catcher who never played a full season and finished with a career batting average of .243.
2018-07-30.headline_main: Baseball Hall of Fame to Celebrate a Catcher (and a Spy)

2018-07-30.abstract: Lawmakers have responded to a crisis in local news coverage by dedicating public money to fund journalism in what is believed to be the first effort of its kind.
2018-07-30.snippet: Lawmakers have responded to a crisis in local news coverage by dedicating public money to fund journalism in what is believed to be the first effort of its kind.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: Like publications in the rest of the country, New Jersey’s suburban newspapers pulled back as their business model vaporized, leaving fewer reporters to dig into local scandals or dispatch to neighborhood events. Tiny outfits like The Village Green, which covers two North Jersey towns, have sought to fill the void.
2018-07-30.headline_main: News From Your Neighborhood, Brought to You by the State of New Jersey

2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: There it was: Glowering red on the dashboard of the sky like an astrological warning light next to the full Blood Moon Friday. Mars.

2018-07-30.abstract: Roughly 37,000 people were forced to evacuate their homes in recent days as wildfires raged, many of them finding temporary refuge in one of five shelters in Redding.
2018-07-30.snippet: Roughly 37,000 people were forced to evacuate their homes in recent days as wildfires raged, many of them finding temporary refuge in one of five shelters in Redding.
2018-07-30.lead_paragraph: REDDING, Calif. — Beneath thick clouds of smoke from the still-burning Carr Fire nearby, Ashley Myers and her family leaned on their small black Subaru on Monday as they ate a breakfast of biscuits and gravy from paper plates outside the CrossPointe Community Church. The family had been at the church, now a shelter, for three days already, after evacuating their home in Redding’s Westwood neighborhood.

2018-07-30.abstract: The senator is central to his party’s fight to defeat President Trump’s Supreme Court nominee, whom Democrats have avoided meeting as they clash with Republicans over access to his emails.
2018-07-30.snippet: The senator is central to his party’s fight to defeat President Trump’s Supreme Court nominee, whom Democrats have avoided meeting as they clash with Republicans over access to his emails.

Kavanaugh, President Trump’s Supreme Court pick, as the two parties escalated their feud over access to documents relating to the nominee.

2018-07-31.abstract: The New York City Council considers a package of bills to freeze the number of Uber-type cars on city streets. But that’s at best a partial answer to a systemic crisis.
2018-07-31.snippet: The New York City Council considers a package of bills to freeze the number of Uber-type cars on city streets. But that’s at best a partial answer to a systemic crisis.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: New York is one of the most prosperous cities in the world, yet it has one of the world’s most dysfunctional transportation systems. Delays plague the subway a year after Gov. Andrew Cuomo and the Metropolitan Transportation Authority promised to fix that mess. The roads, especially in Manhattan, are in not much better shape. Average traffic speeds south of 60th Street have fallen nearly 22 percent in the past seven years, according to the City Department of Transportation. At the same time, many taxi and livery drivers say that they can barely afford to make ends meet — six of them have killed themselves in recent months. One shot himself in front of City Hall to protest officials whom he accused of flooding the streets with for-hire cars and driving him to ruin.
2018-07-31.headline_main: New York City Is Thriving. Why Is Transport Such a Nightmare?

2018-07-31.abstract: Magazine Street has some of the best antique stores, art galleries and one-of-a-kind shops to be found anywhere in New Orleans.
2018-07-31.snippet: Magazine Street has some of the best antique stores, art galleries and one-of-a-kind shops to be found anywhere in New Orleans.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: For shopping or just a casual stroll, no place in New Orleans is quite like Magazine Street, one of the city’s main thoroughfares. The six-mile-long stretch from the Garden District to Uptown, following the curving course of the Mississippi River, has some of the best antique stores, art galleries, craft shops and boutiques to be found anywhere in the city. Lined with mostly 19th-century buildings, including bright Victorian cottages trimmed in quirky gingerbread millwork, Magazine Street has the low-slung scale and mix of small stores — many with one-of-a-kind merchandise —  that makes it an enduring hot spot for locals and visitors alike.
2018-07-31.headline_main: Five Places to Shop in New Orleans

2018-07-31.abstract: A selection of books published this week; plus, a peek at what our colleagues around the newsroom are reading.
2018-07-31.snippet: A selection of books published this week; plus, a peek at what our colleagues around the newsroom are reading.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: THE STRANGE CASE OF DR. COUNEY By Dawn Raffel. (Blue Rider Press, $27.) The use of incubators to save the lives of premature infants has its origins among the sideshows of Coney Island and Atlantic City. As Raffel recounts in this bit of forgotten but fascinating history, at the turn of the 20th century Dr. Martin Couney discovered a novel way to help sickly newborns while also making a few bucks displaying the little wonders alongside bearded ladies and strongmen. HOW SCHOOLS WORK By Arne Duncan. (Simon & Schuster, $26.99.) Obama’s education secretary unpacks his thoughts about what is working and what isn’t in our nation’s school system. He is looking to offer some straight talk, beginning with this opening line: “Education runs on lies.” A FUTURE OF FAITH By Pope Francis with Dominique Wolton. (St. Martin’s, $29.99.) The pope sat down for a series of interviews with a French reporter and this book collects the transcripts, revealing Francis’ thoughts on a wide range of contemporary issues, from immigration to globalization, making even clearer the revolutionary quality of his papacy. VALLEY OF GENIUS By Adam Fisher. (Twelve, $30.) The juggernaut of Silicon Valley now seems like a part of the economy that was always meant to be, but it’s worth remembering how young it is and how haphazard was its start. Fisher has interviewed over 200 people in this expansive oral history of the industry, which stretches from Atari to Facebook. MAEVE IN AMERICA By Maeve Higgins. (Penguin, paper, $16.) The Irish comedian and memoirist writes of her misadventures in the United States after moving here in her 30s and discovering the joys and pains of independence.
2018-07-31.headline_main: New & Noteworthy

2018-07-31.abstract: Beyond the Supreme Court, President Trump has already put a stamp on federal appeals courts, and Senate Republicans have been eager partners in the effort.

2018-07-31.snippet: After last week’s mass shooting, the country needs to consider tougher rules on handguns.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — Last summer I taught a course at the University of Toronto called “American Tragedy: Guns and Mass Shootings in U.S. History.” One memorable day, my 20 mostly Canadian students reflected on the frequency of mass shootings in America and how these calamities don’t receive much public interest unless the gunman claims several lives. One student remarked: “Reading about this stuff makes me so sad. It also makes me happy to live in Canada, where we don’t have to worry about this kind of thing.”
2018-07-31.headline_main: Does Canada Need Better Gun Control?

2018-07-31.abstract: The drama “Buddies,” from 1985, was the first feature about the disease, the work of a writer-director who would die of AIDS complications.
2018-07-31.snippet: The drama “Buddies,” from 1985, was the first feature about the disease, the work of a writer-director who would die of AIDS complications.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: “Philadelphia,” “Parting Glances,” “Longtime Companion” and “Tongues Untied” are often cited as benchmark movies about AIDS. But long forgotten is “Buddies,” the first feature film about AIDS. An intimate two-hander from 1985, it was a snapshot of a terrible time for gay men in New York, made during some of the worst hours of the epidemic.
2018-07-31.headline_main: Long Forgotten, a Landmark Film in AIDS History Is Rescued

2018-07-31.snippet: As big supermarkets struggle, a new crop of local groceries is innovating to serve niche audiences and advance social causes.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — Maj. Gene Hogg, the Salvation Army’s commander for central Maryland, organized mobile kitchens after the twin towers fell in Manhattan and the levees broke in New Orleans. He fed protesters and police officers during the riots that erupted here in 2015 after a young man named Freddie Gray died of injuries he received while in the back of a police van. More than 200 businesses were destroyed, many of them places where people bought food.
2018-07-31.headline_main: The Freshest Ideas Are in Small Grocery Stores

2018-07-31.abstract: The Druse minority have long fought for the Jewish state. Now they are fighting for equality, which is missing from a law declaring Israel “the nation-state of the Jewish people.”

2018-07-31.abstract: Lombardi’s unveils a lavish Chelsea location, a rooftop bar named after a well-connected interior designer and other restaurant news.
2018-07-31.snippet: Lombardi’s unveils a lavish Chelsea location, a rooftop bar named after a well-connected interior designer and other restaurant news.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: Delays in opening a restaurant are common in New York. And the roadblocks are compounded when a place to eat also involves a fully equipped ice cream factory and bakery, as in the case of Ample Hills Creamery Factory and Museum. The location was one of the complications that pushed the opening back the best part of a year. Brian Smith and Jackie Cuscuna, the owners, who founded the company in Prospect Heights seven years ago, were dealing with raw space. “We had to build the infrastructure from scratch,” Mr. Smith said. They also had to switch architects midstream. The new 15,000-square-foot facility, with a scoop shop and counters in front and behind it, a playroom and an interactive museum of ice cream, is built into Beard Street Warehouses. Part of a series of brick storerooms from the mid-19th century, the warehouses were once used to hold goods like cotton and coffee. The space has allowed Ample Hills to improve production with the capacity to churn out 500,000 gallons a year (right now they’re at 50,000). In place of batch freezers, there is now a continuous system. Mix-ins like cookie pieces made in the bakery are added automatically and pints are filled by machine, not by hand. Mr. Smith said that, if anything, this industrialization should enhance the ice cream’s texture. And though the company is now able to deliver pints to many more retail shops, Mr. Smith said they would keep opening scoop shops, adding, “We don’t just want to be pints in grocery stores.” Los Angeles will have an Ample Hills in the fall, followed by another one on Prospect Park West, to bring the total to 13.
2018-07-31.headline_main: Ample Hills Opens Its Red Hook Factory

2018-07-31.abstract: In partnership with the International Rescue Committee, the Welcome Home initiative will offer tours and activities in New York City and Northern California for recently resettled refugees.
2018-07-31.snippet: In partnership with the International Rescue Committee, the Welcome Home initiative will offer tours and activities in New York City and Northern California for recently resettled refugees.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: TripAdvisor wants refugees to the United States to explore and get to know their new homeland, and the hospitality company’s yearlong Welcome Home campaign aims to do just that: launched last week, Welcome Home gives recently resettled refugees in New York City and parts of Northern California the opportunity to book a tour or activity of their choice through TripAdvisor Experiences, a category that offers travelers things to do in around 1,900 destinations globally.
2018-07-31.headline_main: From TripAdvisor, a Program to Help Refugees Get to Know the U.S.

2018-07-31.snippet: Just as Ronald Reagan once pushed for abolishing nuclear weapons, President Trump should call for ending tariffs.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: President Trump won a victory for freer trade last week when he and the president of the European Commission, Jean-Claude Juncker, agreed to find ways to lower tariffs and other barriers to each other’s exports. The outlines of the deal are still sketchy, but it calls for the Europeans to buy more American petroleum, soybeans and manufactured goods and for Mr. Trump to reduce his auto and steel tariffs.

2018-07-31.abstract: In Donal Ryan’s new novel, recently longlisted for the Booker Prize, a Syrian doctor settles in Ireland, where his life intersects with two other shattered men.
2018-07-31.snippet: In Donal Ryan’s new novel, recently longlisted for the Booker Prize, a Syrian doctor settles in Ireland, where his life intersects with two other shattered men.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: “From a Low and Quiet Sea,” a new novel by the Irish writer Donal Ryan, recently longlisted for the Booker Prize, begins with a story snatched from life. When a group of fundamentalists in Syria crucify a small boy, a local doctor, Farouk, and his family decide to flee, taking to the sea in the custody of human smugglers. Catastrophe ensues. Farouk eventually settles in Ireland, and his narrative is braided with the stories of two other shattered men there: Lampy, young and lovelorn, and John, frantically expiating for a life of violence. They are all, in different ways, locked in the “silent, gentle frenzy” of grief when a tragedy (yet another) brings them together.
2018-07-31.headline_main: A Syrian Refugee Lands in Ireland in ‘From a Low and Quiet Sea’

It is the third time the museum, known as MOCA, has picked a leader from New York.

Here’s a timeline of events to keep track of it all.
