2018-07-31.abstract: North Korea is building ICBMs at a facility outside Pyongyang, a sign that the country is continuing its weapons programs despite U.S. diplomacy.
2018-07-31.snippet: North Korea is building ICBMs at a facility outside Pyongyang, a sign that the country is continuing its weapons programs despite U.S. diplomacy.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has consistently touted the results of his North Korean diplomacy, insisting since his June summit meeting with Kim Jong-un that Pyongyang is no longer a nuclear threat and noting that its missile tests have stopped.
2018-07-31.headline_main: Trump Promotes Diplomatic Gains, but North Korea Continues Building Missiles

2018-07-31.abstract: It has been a bruising time for the music trade publication, involving allegations of editorial interference and inappropriate behavior for top executives.
2018-07-31.snippet: It has been a bruising time for the music trade publication, involving allegations of editorial interference and inappropriate behavior for top executives.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: During a recent lunch hour, staff members of the music trade publication Billboard were summoned to a conference room in the magazine’s Midtown Manhattan office. There, managers gave a PowerPoint presentation about corporate values, detailed the results of an employee survey and promised to improve the office culture.
2018-07-31.headline_main: After Top Executive Leaves, Billboard Confronts Its Internal Culture

2018-07-31.abstract: Volkoff, played by Josip Peruzovic, would belt out the Soviet Union’s national anthem before matches, though he had detested life under Communist rule.
2018-07-31.snippet: Volkoff, played by Josip Peruzovic, would belt out the Soviet Union’s national anthem before matches, though he had detested life under Communist rule.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: Nikolai Volkoff, a massive ex-weight lifter who played a Soviet villain in the professional wrestling ring and battled the likes of Bruno Sammartino and Hulk Hogan, died on Sunday at his home in Glen Arm, Md. He was 70.
2018-07-31.headline_main: Nikolai Volkoff, Soviet Villain in the Wrestling Ring, Is Dead at 70

2018-07-31.abstract: Mr. Koch has bristled at some of President Trump’s policies, and this week his unease escalated to open threats. Mr. Trump fought back in tweets.
2018-07-31.snippet: Mr. Koch has bristled at some of President Trump’s policies, and this week his unease escalated to open threats. Mr. Trump fought back in tweets.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump has given Republicans good reason to tolerate his unruly leadership style. His tax cuts, deregulation push and nomination of conservative judges amount to the most orthodox Republican agenda any president has pursued since Ronald Reagan.
2018-07-31.headline_main: Charles Koch Takes On Trump. Trump Takes On Charles Koch.

2018-07-31.abstract: Charles G. Koch, one of the Republicans’ biggest donors, has been critical of President Trump’s protectionist trade policies. Mr. Trump is hitting back, creating tensions that could affect the party in the midterm elections.
2018-07-31.snippet: Charles G. Koch, one of the Republicans’ biggest donors, has been critical of President Trump’s protectionist trade policies. Mr. Trump is hitting back, creating tensions that could affect the party in the midterm elections.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: Charles G. Koch, one of the Republicans’ biggest donors, has been critical of President Trump’s protectionist trade policies. Mr. Trump is hitting back, creating tensions that could affect the party in the midterm elections.
2018-07-31.headline_main: How the Koch-Trump Rift Could Shape the Midterms

2018-07-31.abstract: Its new president can help his country and the world by tackling climate change through sustainable development.
2018-07-31.snippet: Its new president can help his country and the world by tackling climate change through sustainable development.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: Mexican voters elected Andrés Manuel López Obrador president on July 1 largely based on his promises to solve the country’s most devastating domestic problems: rampant violence, economic inequality and widespread corruption. Mr. López Obrador, however, also has the chance to catapult his country into a leadership role on an issue that will benefit both Mexico and the rest of the globe: climate change.
2018-07-31.headline_main: Can Mexico Run on Clean Energy?

2018-07-31.abstract: Great performances, including Samora Pinderhughes debuting a full suite of new material, on stages across New York.
2018-07-31.snippet: Great performances, including Samora Pinderhughes debuting a full suite of new material, on stages across New York.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: Welcome to “The Month in Live Jazz,” a column highlighting three standout performances from the past month on stages across New York City.
2018-07-31.headline_main: Live Jazz: 3 July Standouts, From Thumbscrew to Nabaté Isles

2018-07-31.abstract: So-called fintech firms, like Square, can apply for a new kind of banking charter from the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, allowing them to expand nationwide more easily.
2018-07-31.snippet: So-called fintech firms, like Square, can apply for a new kind of banking charter from the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency, allowing them to expand nationwide more easily.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: The federal government began clearing a path on Tuesday for online lenders and payment companies to more easily and directly compete with traditional banks, a change that one regulator said would allow innovative businesses to expand nationwide.
2018-07-31.headline_main: Online Lenders and Payment Companies Get a Way to Act More Like Banks

2018-07-31.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, August 1, 2018.
2018-07-31.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, August 1, 2018.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: “The South Koreans have said the North Koreans have agreed to give up nuclear weapons. Trump has said they have agreed to give them up. But they have never said it.”
2018-07-31.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: North Korea Keeps Building Missiles Despite U.S. Overtures

2018-07-31.abstract: The journalists were making a documentary about the activities of a private Russian paramilitary group with murky connections to the Kremlin.
2018-07-31.snippet: The journalists were making a documentary about the activities of a private Russian paramilitary group with murky connections to the Kremlin.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Three Russian journalists investigating the activities of a private security company with murky Kremlin connections have been killed in the Central African Republic, the Russian authorities said Tuesday.
2018-07-31.headline_main: 3 Russian Journalists Killed in Central African Republic

2018-07-31.abstract: James Shields said the financial stress of fighting for his 6-year-old son was weighing on him before he killed himself, the boy, his ex-wife and current wife.
2018-07-31.snippet: James Shields said the financial stress of fighting for his 6-year-old son was weighing on him before he killed himself, the boy, his ex-wife and current wife.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: To some friends and neighbors, James Shields seemed to be a gregarious man who loved to throw parties in his backyard in Queens. But in private he had been seething for months over a battle with his ex-wife to win custody of their 6-year-old son, police officials said.
2018-07-31.headline_main: Queens Killings Stemmed From Custody Dispute in the Netherlands

2018-07-31.abstract: The team’s front-office-by-committee will be blamed by some for the team’s inaction at the trade deadline, but the team says it’s not their fault.
2018-07-31.snippet: The team’s front-office-by-committee will be blamed by some for the team’s inaction at the trade deadline, but the team says it’s not their fault.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It was clear long ago that this Mets season was lost. Entering Tuesday, they had the third-worst record in the National League.
2018-07-31.headline_main: With No Attractive Offers, the Mets Stand Pat

2018-07-31.abstract: Imran Khan, the presumptive prime minister, has sought to temper his past anti-American speech. But his election could signal more tensions in an already strained relationship.
2018-07-31.snippet: Imran Khan, the presumptive prime minister, has sought to temper his past anti-American speech. But his election could signal more tensions in an already strained relationship.
2018-07-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The rise of Imran Khan, a former cricket star who is Pakistan’s likely next leader, could complicate new talks between American diplomats and the Taliban about ending the war in Afghanistan, officials said, fraying an already strained relationship between the nuclear-armed Islamic nation and the Trump administration.
2018-07-31.headline_main: Pakistan’s Likely New Leader Could Complicate Afghan Peace Talks
